column4: ergodyne chill-its evaporative cooling vest
column6: i ordered the same size as i normally do with clothing, but it was way too big.  i can only hope it shrinks when used.

column4: ergodyne chill-its evaporative cooling vest
column6: maybe the problem is my expectations, but having never bought cooling gear before i expected a bit more. what i received was a vest that says it has polyester and cotton in it in the materials tag on the vest. there's no mention of pva anywhere, and i realize now that the "activated polymer inside" doesn't actually specify what type of plastic they talk about in this vest.so, essentially, this is a cotton t-shirt wrapped in a layer of plastic on the outside.the expectation was that it would soak in water to its core and leave the surface at most clammy. this thing is soaking wet on the outside even after you wring it dry after immersion, and the water flows down and when the top is dry-ish, the hem is dripping. so, i can only assume this isn't in any way a "high-tech" vest with pva that soaks up a lot of water and slowly releases it to get the cooling effect.. it's a bog standard cotton-polyester vest that you can soak in water.i bought a chill-its hat alongside this. that clearly states it does have pva in the sweatband. and the sweatband in the hat is clearly different to the vest - it's cold and somewhat clammy feeling without feeling wet. that is what i expected from the vest, but this vest appears to have none of this more unusual material in it, making it lower tech and i suppose mildly better than just wearing a wet t-shirt. disappointing. it will cool you down, i'm sure, but at the cost of also soaking through your clothing most likely caveat emptor.

column4: ergodyne chill-its evaporative cooling vest
column6: it gets the job done but might be heavy for certain types of outdoor activities. recommend soak it, ring it out , then put it in the freezer over night. lasts a few hours be f ore chilling is needed again.

column4: ergodyne chill-its evaporative cooling vest
column6: my husband said it works well and keeps his cool in the arizona heat

column4: ergodyne chill-its evaporative cooling vest
column6: im hochsommer den anhänger beladen oder draußen arbeiten? geil!bei rekord-hitze kann man den auch mal so auf t-shirt tragen und angenehm alle 30min mal im nächsten öffentlichen springbrunnen nass machen wärend alle anderen leute vor hitze stöhnen.achtung! bei sehr anstrengender arbeit hinterher sofort ausziehen, sonst verkühlt mach sich leicht.

column4: ergodyne chill-its evaporative cooling vest
column6: pas très convaincu de l’efficacité de se produit . utilisé quelque fois pendant les fortes chaleurs avec ma moto et bof bof ...

column4: ergodyne chill-its evaporative cooling vest
column6: lo utilizo para montar en moto en verano debajo de una chaqueta ventilada. para mí se ha convertido en indispensable, es sorprendente la reducción de temperatura que aporta. en mi caso y con el uso que le doy, tengo que volver a mojarlo cada dos horas aproximadamente

column4: ergodyne chill-its evaporative cooling vest
column6: dollar for dollar , this is one of the best values i’ve come across in regards for what i got for what i spent. first off , the different colors are priced differently. i was able to immediately shave ten bucks off the price by choosing the cheapest color. it makes no difference at all since it’ll never be seen under my riding gear. i paid just a bit over $20 when the other colors were in upwards of $30. the vest arrived in the middle of brutal heatwave , with temps in the high nineties. i soaked the vest in ice water while i put on my other gear and prepped the bike. once i put the vest on , the comfort was immediate. i rode about 100 miles in temps that never dipped below 96 and at no point in the ride did i ever feel uncomfortably hot. i was cool and comfortable the whole time. no cutting edge tech here. just a simple accessory that took one of the biggest negatives out of my summer rides. i’ve seen evaporative cooling vests from name brands for $100 or more. idk , maybe they have some fancy bells and whistles that make them better than this one but i can’t justify spending more when this vest does exactly what i want it to do. dry it in the sun when you’re done to prevent bad smell/mold. my hot summer rides are now just as comfortable as my autumn rides , and for only twenty something dollars.

column4: ergodyne chill-its evaporative cooling vest
column6: bought for my missus, she loves it!

column4: ergodyne chill-its evaporative cooling vest
column6: di questo "gilet raffreddante" non mi è piaciuto assolutamente nulla. appena bagnato si è intriso cosi tanto di acqua che poi per asciugarsi ci ha messo diversi giorni.prodotto completamente inutilizzabile in quanto indossare un gilet zuppo addosso non so quanto possa giovare anche in piena estate. un consiglio non lo acquistate che tanto poi dovete procedere al reso come ho fatto io.

column4: ergodyne chill-its evaporative cooling vest
ergodyne chill-its evaporative cooling vest
column6: i give it 5 stars although for me, i have to do some extra steps.  it works best if i don't wear a shirt underneath and if i refrigerate the vest after it's been soaked in water.  putting it on is kind of shock but it really keeps my temperature down.  it kind of works if you just soak and/or wear a shirt underneath.once you get it on, it doesn't drip.i haven't tried freezing it solid - just refrigerating or stashing in the freezer for 15 minutes.  if you don't refrigerate, remember that it uses evaporative cooling and works best if the humidity is not high.  i haven't tried it in anything above 60% humidity but the higher the humidity, the less effective it is.  in that case, i'd buy two and keep one in a cooler with ice and just keep swapping.  i think that is cheaper than some of the more expensive vests which have cool packs built in.

column4: ergodyne chill-its evaporative cooling vest
column6: works great on hot days while riding my motorcycle in south texas heat.

column4: ergodyne chill-its evaporative cooling vest
column6: me permet de faire du jogging même s'il fait 30 degrés. après l'avoir bien  mouillé (ça goutte un peu sur le short), on peu courir confortablement pendant 20 à 25 minutes. après, il faut trouver un point d'eau pour le mouiller à nouveau. il faut planifier l'itinéraire pour être certain de trouver de l'eau, mais pour le prix, c'est pas si mal.

column4: ergodyne chill-its evaporative cooling vest
column5: muy buen producto, se ajusta bien a las defensas de una ultra limited
column6: lo utilice en un viaje en moto de varios días y me ayudo bastante en mantenerme fresco ante el calor intenso de la carretera. lo recomiendo bastante para este tipo de uso.

column4: ergodyne chill-its evaporative cooling vest
column6: je roule à moto dans le gard (france) sous le soleil et après avoir trempé ce gilet dans l'eau froide, le laisser échapper le surplus d'eau, je l'enfile sur un t-shirt sous la veste moto . . .  enfin, une régulation de ma température corporelle. . .  fini de transpirer à grosses gouttes de sueur dans les embarras de circulation . . .  l'effet de refroidissement dure jusqu'à 3 heures c'est selon le type de randonnée à moto et les conditions météos.  trouver une source d'eau froide ne pose aucune difficulté puisqu'il faut aussi abreuver en carburant le 2 roues.conclusion : super achat qui améliore l'attention et donc la sécurité du conducteur  puisque celui-ci n'est pas "anesthésié" par la chaleur du sud.  a recommander.

column4: ergodyne chill-its evaporative cooling vest
column6: i bought 3 of these recently. one for my husband, myself and his friend. we live in north carolina where the summers are unbearably humid and hot. the guys go golfing and can deal but i simply cannot!my husband and i tested it out on a bike ride for about an hour and it kept us considerably cooler! we did soak our vests in ice water (separately) for about 5 minutes, lightly wrung them out and patted them “dry” with a towel. as other reviewers mentioned water does drip on your pants quite a lot and soaks your shirt (we wore “dri-fits”). with the humidity , we would have had sweated and been much hotter so it’s a fair trade off , especially with the price point.my husband did test hitting a few golf balls as well and said it was not cumbersome and plans to wear it golfing, to mow our grass etc.lastly, the lime green is definitely neon yellow but when you feel the coldness against your skin, who cares?definitely recommend!

column4: ergodyne chill-its evaporative cooling vest
column6: this is very effective.  i soaked it for a minute or two and wrung it out.  went for a ride in my golf cart in 112 degrees.  felt good.  let the vest hang outside in the shade for a couple hours.  put it back on and rode in the cart for another hour at 110 degrees.  it kept me cool the entire time.  beware that these really are large!  i take a 2xl and sometimes 3xl for shirts.  i am 6' tall and come in at 260#s.  my chest is 48" (and my belly is almost the same).  the 2xl is a bit big for me but i will keep it because it does work well.  tonight, i ordered another 1xl vest which should be just about perfect

column4: ergodyne chill-its evaporative cooling vest
column6: got for my husband for fathers day. he loves it especially in this texas heat. it does exactly what it says it will.  keeps his upper body cool for hours at a time. he uses it mainly when he rides his motorcycle being that it just gets too hot to ride in the afternoons down here. he would stuff his jacket pockets with ice packets before he got this but they would melt before his commute home, now he stays nice and cool the whole ride home. he has also been know to use it when mowing the lawn also, and i’m sure will come up with many more uses. he keeps it stored mainly in a jumbo ziploc baggie filled with water so its ready to go at all times. awesome and truly lifesaving product. thank you!! 🏻🏻

column4: ergodyne chill-its evaporative cooling vest
column6: este chaleco parece bueno pero el resultado no es el deseado, una vez mojado deja caer demasiadas gotas ¿?, lo que hace que nopuedas fiarte de no quedarte medio empapado al cabo del rato.tendría que ser totalmente ermético y no dejar salir agua por la parte de abajo.los portes perfectos x amazon.

column4: ergodyne chill-its evaporative cooling vest
column6: j'ai tout de suite essayé ce gilet sous une combinaison de pilote par forte chaleur. humide, il fait un certain poids mais ça ne gêne pas. le contact n'est pas tres agreable mais il est efficace. on sent bien la sensation de fraicheur.attention à ne pas le garder trop longtemps sur soi, sinon rhume garanti !autre inconvénient : il se décolore vite et les vetements en contact peuvent eux se colorer ou décolorer.

column4: ergodyne chill-its evaporative cooling vest
column6: i work at amazon in a warehouse.  it's been really hot lately, so i thought i'd order this just for myself.  i don't do well it high heat and even simple things like walking, i'd break out in an extreme sweat.the vest does work well (but expect drips if you fully soak it for maximum cooling) and dripped on clothing.  it doesn't leak on the inside as that's waterproof, but the water does tend to 'pool' at the bottom of the vest and then drip if really soaked.  i can't have those drips so have to just soak the top half for safety reasons.  it does provide the cooling needed and especially on my bare arms that rub against the vest.  it does cool well.  to maximize the cooling effect, recharge it every 2.5 hours at minimum if you are using cold tap water like i do. (i want to freeze this or use ultra cold water).  if you don't, it gets a very humid feeling, at least for me in a warehouse where temps average 90degrees plus right now.the more you soak it, the better it is.  the colder the water is, the better it is.it does feel heavy.. but only at first.  you get used to it quickly and appreciate the lower temp feeling.  it has made quite a difference in my quality of life chart working in a warehouse.  i wish we used these for all employees.i am happy with my purchase and do recommend it to others with a few cautions as explained above.tho it does feel a bit like wearing a wet t-shirt at times.4/5 stars.

column4: ergodyne chill-its evaporative cooling vest
column6: this thing is a life saver. i was dying on a motorcycle ride out to ottawa last summer with temperatures between 30-35c. i put this on and my temperature instantly dropped. thing is you really must have it exposed to the wind. if you wear it under a jacket, the upper chest part will dry out leaving the bottom permanently moist. the only reason it doesnt get 5 stars is it leaks and the water eventually finds its way to the bottom of the vest where its not cooling much anymore.i bought a medium and it's slightly baggy on me: you want it as tight as comfortable for it to work best. i'm 5'9" around 170lbs.i'm glad this is a part of my permanent motorcycle gear selection.

column4: ergodyne chill-its evaporative cooling vest
column6: arrivato nei tempi previsti. lo uso per turismo sotto un giubbotto da moto con abondanti parti a rete e nel caldo torrido e in viaggio si sente il beneficio.

column4: ergodyne chill-its evaporative cooling vest
column6: i do think they lose their cooling effectiveness as the summer goes on. i notice the vest is considerably lighter, so the little cooling granules are used up or possibly squeezed out by then. i get it as wet as possible and just try to barely squeeze out the excess water so that i don't leave a water trail from the sink to my work site (which is actually my car---i also don't really want my seat soaking wet...just me!). i am a mail carrier so my air conditioner doesn't help much in the summer when we work with the window open. these vests are far superior to the ice vests i was using as i can just carry a bottle of water and refresh it quickly. i carry a 6packsize cooler full of water and just dunk it in there every few hours and keep on moving!

column4: ergodyne chill-its evaporative cooling vest
column6: the 3x is actually quite big. i should have got the 2x for a snug fit. as it is a vest. it gets heavy but worth it.  i put mine in chilled water and then put in deep freezer.it should be noted that this does have a slime feel to it. in 30 degrees of hotness in my workplace the vest deep frozen holds its coolness for about an hour. then i freeze again for 15 minutes.

column4: ergodyne chill-its evaporative cooling vest
column6: positiv : hält was sie verspricht.negativ: wird durch das wasser sehr schwer.verliert das wasser nach und nach wodurch man vom rücken an abwärts komplett nass wird.also eher nichts wenn man sich damit viel bewegen muss.

column4: ergodyne chill-its evaporative cooling vest
column6: je l'ai acheté pour mon père qui travaille dans une usine très chaude ! il aime, ça rafraichit ! je n'y croyais pas, certes c'est pas la clim, mais quand on bosse dehors ou en usine c'est essentiel immpossible de ne pas l'avoir !

column4: ergodyne chill-its evaporative cooling vest
column6: when wet ,  this item is very heavy. it did produce noticeable cooling and i was glad to have it. the size i chose was too large but i ordered the  largest one .

column4: ergodyne chill-its evaporative cooling vest
column6: hallo, eine kühlweste sollte kühlen und das tut sie. die weste ist sehr angenehm zu tragen. die passform entspricht den normalen größen.

column4: ergodyne chill-its evaporative cooling vest
column6: may wan to size down.  this is a great  cooling vest. i had to wear a shirt over it to keep the vest plastered to my body because it was too big when doused in cold water.

column4: ergodyne chill-its evaporative cooling vest
column6: this works!  a bit of trial and error for me (the first few times i did not blot enuf = my clothes got wet, but since i was in my backyard in 100 degree heat, i didnt' care.  for out in public at friend's houses for example, i had to learn how to better blot.  it definitely doesn't get me cold, but it does help keep me cool for about 3 hours in 90+ degree weather.  the only reason i'm not giving it 5 stars (and perhaps i'm just not realistic), i would be ecstatic if this actually got colder than it does.  o well, i'm happy w/ this as i'm not aware of anything else (w/in a reasonable price point) that would do a better job.  o and i recommended this to my dad who preaches as a deacon in a church that while big, doesn't get very cool up in the alter area and he is thrilled too - he wears it over his shirt, but under his vestments (he got the beige color) and says it really helps him.  btw - the customer service for ergodyne (a local company for me) is wonderful - i had a question about sizing and the gal i called in customer service was gracious and extremely helpful!  her advice helped me to choose the right size the 1st time around :)

column4: ergodyne chill-its evaporative cooling vest
column6: being *extremely* sensitive to heat, and working outside these days to rebuild the backyard deck, i had rivers of sweat pouring down my eyes, blinding me in minutes. today, in another 35c heat day, with this vest, i was as cool as a 'the dude' leboswki.on the down side, your clothes will be wet.on the plus side, you will survive the heat !

column4: ergodyne chill-its evaporative cooling vest
column6: excellent product. i'm pretty sure this is the same manufacturer that makes cooling vests for sedici (motorcycle brand) order down a size! i'm 5'9 l and an xl with "slim fit" shirts. i trusted the reviews and ordered down a size.. the medium fit perfectly.it's incredible what a difference this jacket made for me. for my motorcycle people: you need this! it fit perfectly in my suit and did not restrict movement or make me feel uncomfortable. jacket lasts about 40 minutes before you need to toss it back into your ice chest (which is perfect!) make sure it's soaked in water or else your body won't be able to transfer heat to the jacket as efficiently.i was hydrating as frequently as i would with a normal trackday and i could barely break a sweat in 90 degree weather. i didn't wear the jacket for one of the sessions...suddenly i was extremely uncomfortable i had sweat running down my eyes.stop doubting and buy!

column4: ergodyne chill-its evaporative cooling vest
column6: yes, there are probably better options out on the market but, for the price, this vest works as described. i think they are a little larger than posted…l see where folks get them wet and put them in the fridge, before using them. we don’t have that luxury when your riding 450 miles in 100 degree dry heat for 7-8 hours a day. in this type of weather, l was stopping every 3 hours and refuel the bike and rewatering the vest… the lime yellow is very bright and noticeable, good for visibility by others. the vest keeps me alert and comfortable too… well made and affordable..

column4: ergodyne chill-its evaporative cooling vest
column6: high quality materials.  absorbs a lot of water without being heavy or awkward.  holds onto moisture but dries completely. instantly cools the body like jumping into water... so i would day it will buy an hour in the okanagan sun where it is dry but very very hot.

column4: ergodyne chill-its evaporative cooling vest
column6: i use this for woodworking in my garage during the summer in tucson. this plus a bucket of ice water to recharge and a fan works pretty good to stay cool. three stars because it seems to leak some of the gel every time i soak it.

column4: ergodyne chill-its evaporative cooling vest
column6: i was not impressed. wetting the vest down with cold water didn't keep me any cooler. i even went to the extreme and placed it in my freezer. once it was frozen, the coolnest only lasted for about 20 minutes. the vest also adds a few pounds to your burden of having to wear extra weight in the heat. i will be returning it.

column4: ergodyne chill-its evaporative cooling vest
column6: i bought this for my husband who works outside in the texas heat. he tried it a couple of times and doesn't like it. if it's excessively hot, 100+, this really won't help. it might be effective in less hot and humid climates. not a bad product just didn't work for him.

column4: ergodyne chill-its evaporative cooling vest
column6: utilisé pour rouler en moto à des températures >40c.double avantage, ça la peau humidifié dans des zones ultra sec. et ça rafraîchit vraiment l'air porté sous ma veste de moto d'été.attention, comme marqué dans d'autres avis, aux premières utilisation ça peut tâcher (attention au blanc).et ça taille vraiment très grand. ce large équivaut un xxl en europe.

column4: ergodyne chill-its evaporative cooling vest
column6: i thought the vest may have a special absorbent liner between the outer and inner shell, but appears to be only 2 layers of fabric. hence it does weep considerably after being soaked and wrung and the water travels to the lower parts. in retrospect any soaked fabric vest would have the same effect. it does fit well and comfortable and does cool by keeping your t-shirt soaked - which isn't a bad thing when you're sweating anyways.

column4: ergodyne chill-its evaporative cooling vest
column6: nach dem eintauchen in wasser wirkt die weste deutlich nass und gibt die feuchtigkeit nach innen und aussen ab. wechselklamotten mitnehmen..

column4: columbia men's vest, powder pass
column6: j’ai acheté cette doudoune sans manche pour m’accompagner sur les terrains de golfs et franchement je ne suis pas déçu. la couleur est très sobre et la marque discrète. le confort est top et le col épais fait en sorte qu’il ne s’affaisse pas ce qui donne un look très élégant. seul bémol pour ma part c’est qu’il n’y a pas de poche en zip à l’intérieur de la veste. mais pour le reste je suis très content. pour le prix je recommande !

column4: columbia men's steens mountain full zip 2.0
column6: amazon had a note on the product page: "large will fit you best based on data from customers who buy the same sizes as you" - i wanted to believe this algorithm was correct & glad i read other reviews - i'm 5'7" 110-115 lbs w a waist size of 29/30" - i looked at the sizing table and sure enough small is my size which i was suspicious of as i usually get medium. i got lucky medium went out of stock & gambled on the small. while waiting, i realized my trusty old fleece i am replacing is a columbia & a small!  that cinched the deal & put me at peace. when it arrived today, it fits just as well - it doesnt seem as thick as my old one so i'm gonna just have to try it on my upcoming trip to cooler regions & see how it performs. i hope it lasts as long as my old one - it's easily been a daily driver for over 5 years (i wouldn't doubt if it is 10 years old to be honest!) - the cuffs are completely stretched out & just found out it will be easy to replace the broken yyk zip pull so it will be regulated to casual use as it a *very* effective middle layer with a turtleneck (or thermal) underneath & windbreaker on top!again, this review is mostly to inform about sizing to help others nail it the first time - i just put my experience with a prior columbia product i've been more than happy with that led to this purchase.  i'll probably update this review after i've used the new one extensively in a very similar manner (esp camping ️)update (5/2/23): the new one seems surprisingly warmer - i don’t know if it’s because of the sheer age of the old one - but thinner/warmer/lighter is always welcome. i also noticed they cut costs by only putting one cinch buckle around the waist (it used to be on both sides) - the quality of the buckle is smaller and clearly cheaper & the elastic that goes around is thinner.  i’m glad the waist elastic is still in the product but it sure doesn’t look like it’s going to last 10-15 years - i guess we’ll see.  you’ll also have to wash and/or air out the fleece - while it’s not overbearing - i could tell my skin felt a bit sensitive to whatever leftover chemicals that were left from the process and i only put it on for maybe 15 min while it was new?  and i can confirm that they’ve switched from the embroidered logo for a stitched tag - before it was very subtle and blended and now it’s blatant branding (which i do have mixed feelings about).  the zips are still yyk fortunately. this one is made in bangladesh (where my old one was made in vietnam).  okay these are just first impressions - now to put it to some rigorous field testing for a few years!update (6/8/23): just got back from a 18 day trip and this has been field tested :) it did well in 50 degree weather in the santa cruz mountains layered w a turtleneck (uniqlo heat tech) and a windbreaker (i could notice a big difference without the windbreaker, in fact, i was cold in 50 degree weather. in 60 degree weather layered with a quick dry t & long sleeve shell, i was plenty warm without the windbreaker). something that is annoying is the way they've attached the rope pulls on the zippers - they've come off 2 or 3x already - you're likely to lose them if you are not careful. once it came off casually & yesterday i went to wash it & one was just lying inside the machine - it's only attached via a simple loop to the zip pull & clearly a "cosmetic" thing. i'm tempted to dock a star but from a pure functionally standpoint, the fleece did its most basic job (keep me warm!) and looks so much better than my drab grey one i had prior!  i'm still satisfied :)

column6: me he comprado los dos forros polares, el glacier de north face y este de columbia, básicamente uno compite directamente con el otro. los dos me encantan, si bien la talla m es mucho mas ajustada para el de north face que el de columbia que es mas holgado, aunque no es que te quede grande, simplemente hay tipos de forros polares, unos que te permiten poner mas ropa en el interior, y otros que se ajustan mas para cuando no necesitas mas ropa pero estar cómodo y calentito. por ejemplo si hace mucho frio durante años me he puesto dos forros polares y no necesitaba chaqueta (lo que me parecía super comodo), pero siempre me ponía dos holgados, ahora podré ponerme el glacier debajo y este encima, genial. estoy por comprar otro, los dos son de alta calidad y calientan mucho, cremalleras como me gustan en los bolsillos, y un precio absurdamente bajo en comparación al precio cuando salieron, estos forros son mucho mejores que los forros de otras marcas al mismo precio.

column4: tommy hilfiger men's ultra loft lightweight packable puffer jacket (standard and big & tall)
column6: just received this jacket and first impression is very good. medium - fits well if a tad snug. the feel of the jacket is smooth and soft. the color, red, is not a bright red, so fits my color tastes perfectly. zippers are very smooth up and down. i like that it zips all the way up into a high collar, keeping the neck area warm in cold/cool air. inside pockets on both sides, nice. stepped outside for a minute on this cool not cold day and it feels quite warm. will see over time how warm it is in colder weather. i do have a heavier hilfiger jacket for very cold weather so this was bought for cool to cooler weather. obviously have not worn it in the rain, but then i do not spend a lot of time in the rain, so it is not of much concern to me. i'm sure it will do fine for running to and from the car. noticed one commenter complained it is cheap and thin. i'd ask what do you not understand about the description that say's it is a lightweight jacket. still it does not strike me as cheap (very reasonably priced) and of good quality. if my experience changes i'll be back to update, but for now i am very satisfied with this jacket and am thinking of getting another with the ice color and maybe a step up in size. though i do like a slim look as compared to big and bulky, so maybe not. ;-)

column4: brandit summer windbreaker,rain jacket,jacket,training jacket, size s to 5xl
column6: ich habe mir vor einiger zeit eine herren regenjacke zugelegt, und ich kann ehrlich sagen, dass es eine der besten investitionen war, die ich für meine outdoor-aktivitäten getätigt habe. diese regenjacke hat sich in jeder hinsicht als herausragend erwiesen, und ich möchte meine erfahrungen gerne teilen.die wasserdichtigkeit dieser jacke ist beeindruckend. egal, ob es nur leicht regnet oder in strömen gießt, diese jacke hält mich trocken. das material ist von hoher qualität und hält den regen effektiv ab, ohne dabei sperrig oder unbequem zu sein. ich kann meine aktivitäten im freien ohne angst vor nässe genießen.was mich besonders begeistert, ist die atmungsaktivität dieser regenjacke. selbst bei intensiven wanderungen oder aktivitäten, bei denen ich ins schwitzen gerate, fühle ich mich nicht unangenehm feucht oder überhitzt. die belüftungssysteme funktionieren hervorragend, um ein angenehmes körperklima zu gewährleisten.die langlebigkeit dieser herren regenjacke hat mich ebenfalls überzeugt. trotz mehrfacher benutzung und verschiedener wetterbedingungen zeigt sie keinerlei abnutzungserscheinungen. die qualität der verarbeitung ist wirklich bemerkenswert.in bezug auf das design bin ich äußerst zufrieden. diese jacke ist in verschiedenen farben und stilen erhältlich, so dass sie zu unterschiedlichen anlässen und outfits passt. sie ist funktional und gleichzeitig modisch, was mir sehr gefällt.zusammengefasst kann ich diese herren regenjacke nur wärmstens empfehlen. sie bietet erstklassigen schutz vor regen und wind, ist bequem zu tragen und sieht dabei auch noch großartig aus. diese jacke hat sich wirklich als unverzichtbares kleidungsstück für outdoor-enthusiasten erwiesen, und ich kann sie jedem empfehlen, der nach einer hochwertigen und stilvollen regenjacke sucht.

column4: ergodyne chill-its evaporative cooling vest
column6: maybe the problem is my expectations, but having never bought cooling gear before i expected a bit more. what i received was a vest that says it has polyester and cotton in it in the materials tag on the vest. there's no mention of pva anywhere, and i realize now that the "activated polymer inside" doesn't actually specify what type of plastic they talk about in this vest.so, essentially, this is a cotton t-shirt wrapped in a layer of plastic on the outside.the expectation was that it would soak in water to its core and leave the surface at most clammy. this thing is soaking wet on the outside even after you wring it dry after immersion, and the water flows down and when the top is dry-ish, the hem is dripping. so, i can only assume this isn't in any way a "high-tech" vest with pva that soaks up a lot of water and slowly releases it to get the cooling effect.. it's a bog standard cotton-polyester vest that you can soak in water.i bought a chill-its hat alongside this. that clearly states it does have pva in the sweatband. and the sweatband in the hat is clearly different to the vest - it's cold and somewhat clammy feeling without feeling wet. that is what i expected from the vest, but this vest appears to have none of this more unusual material in it, making it lower tech and i suppose mildly better than just wearing a wet t-shirt. disappointing. it will cool you down, i'm sure, but at the cost of also soaking through your clothing most likely caveat emptor.

column4: ergodyne chill-its evaporative cooling vest
column6: lo utilizo para montar en moto en verano debajo de una chaqueta ventilada. para mí se ha convertido en indispensable, es sorprendente la reducción de temperatura que aporta. en mi caso y con el uso que le doy, tengo que volver a mojarlo cada dos horas aproximadamente

column4: ergodyne chill-its evaporative cooling vest
column6: dollar for dollar , this is one of the best values i’ve come across in regards for what i got for what i spent. first off , the different colors are priced differently. i was able to immediately shave ten bucks off the price by choosing the cheapest color. it makes no difference at all since it’ll never be seen under my riding gear. i paid just a bit over $20 when the other colors were in upwards of $30. the vest arrived in the middle of brutal heatwave , with temps in the high nineties. i soaked the vest in ice water while i put on my other gear and prepped the bike. once i put the vest on , the comfort was immediate. i rode about 100 miles in temps that never dipped below 96 and at no point in the ride did i ever feel uncomfortably hot. i was cool and comfortable the whole time. no cutting edge tech here. just a simple accessory that took one of the biggest negatives out of my summer rides. i’ve seen evaporative cooling vests from name brands for $100 or more. idk , maybe they have some fancy bells and whistles that make them better than this one but i can’t justify spending more when this vest does exactly what i want it to do. dry it in the sun when you’re done to prevent bad smell/mold. my hot summer rides are now just as comfortable as my autumn rides , and for only twenty something dollars.

column4: ergodyne chill-its evaporative cooling vest

column4: ergodyne chill-its evaporative cooling vest

column4: ergodyne chill-its evaporative cooling vest
ergodyne chill-its evaporative cooling vest
column6: i give it 5 stars although for me, i have to do some extra steps.  it works best if i don't wear a shirt underneath and if i refrigerate the vest after it's been soaked in water.  putting it on is kind of shock but it really keeps my temperature down.  it kind of works if you just soak and/or wear a shirt underneath.once you get it on, it doesn't drip.i haven't tried freezing it solid - just refrigerating or stashing in the freezer for 15 minutes.  if you don't refrigerate, remember that it uses evaporative cooling and works best if the humidity is not high.  i haven't tried it in anything above 60% humidity but the higher the humidity, the less effective it is.  in that case, i'd buy two and keep one in a cooler with ice and just keep swapping.  i think that is cheaper than some of the more expensive vests which have cool packs built in.

column5: muy buen producto, se ajusta bien a las defensas de una ultra limited
column6: lo utilice en un viaje en moto de varios días y me ayudo bastante en mantenerme fresco ante el calor intenso de la carretera. lo recomiendo bastante para este tipo de uso.

column4: ergodyne chill-its evaporative cooling vest
column6: je roule à moto dans le gard (france) sous le soleil et après avoir trempé ce gilet dans l'eau froide, le laisser échapper le surplus d'eau, je l'enfile sur un t-shirt sous la veste moto . . .  enfin, une régulation de ma température corporelle. . .  fini de transpirer à grosses gouttes de sueur dans les embarras de circulation . . .  l'effet de refroidissement dure jusqu'à 3 heures c'est selon le type de randonnée à moto et les conditions météos.  trouver une source d'eau froide ne pose aucune difficulté puisqu'il faut aussi abreuver en carburant le 2 roues.conclusion : super achat qui améliore l'attention et donc la sécurité du conducteur  puisque celui-ci n'est pas "anesthésié" par la chaleur du sud.  a recommander.

column4: ergodyne chill-its evaporative cooling vest
column6: i bought 3 of these recently. one for my husband, myself and his friend. we live in north carolina where the summers are unbearably humid and hot. the guys go golfing and can deal but i simply cannot!my husband and i tested it out on a bike ride for about an hour and it kept us considerably cooler! we did soak our vests in ice water (separately) for about 5 minutes, lightly wrung them out and patted them “dry” with a towel. as other reviewers mentioned water does drip on your pants quite a lot and soaks your shirt (we wore “dri-fits”). with the humidity , we would have had sweated and been much hotter so it’s a fair trade off , especially with the price point.my husband did test hitting a few golf balls as well and said it was not cumbersome and plans to wear it golfing, to mow our grass etc.lastly, the lime green is definitely neon yellow but when you feel the coldness against your skin, who cares?definitely recommend!

column4: ergodyne chill-its evaporative cooling vest
column6: this is very effective.  i soaked it for a minute or two and wrung it out.  went for a ride in my golf cart in 112 degrees.  felt good.  let the vest hang outside in the shade for a couple hours.  put it back on and rode in the cart for another hour at 110 degrees.  it kept me cool the entire time.  beware that these really are large!  i take a 2xl and sometimes 3xl for shirts.  i am 6' tall and come in at 260#s.  my chest is 48" (and my belly is almost the same).  the 2xl is a bit big for me but i will keep it because it does work well.  tonight, i ordered another 1xl vest which should be just about perfect

column4: ergodyne chill-its evaporative cooling vest
column6: got for my husband for fathers day. he loves it especially in this texas heat. it does exactly what it says it will.  keeps his upper body cool for hours at a time. he uses it mainly when he rides his motorcycle being that it just gets too hot to ride in the afternoons down here. he would stuff his jacket pockets with ice packets before he got this but they would melt before his commute home, now he stays nice and cool the whole ride home. he has also been know to use it when mowing the lawn also, and i’m sure will come up with many more uses. he keeps it stored mainly in a jumbo ziploc baggie filled with water so its ready to go at all times. awesome and truly lifesaving product. thank you!! 🏻🏻

column4: ergodyne chill-its evaporative cooling vest
column6: este chaleco parece bueno pero el resultado no es el deseado, una vez mojado deja caer demasiadas gotas ¿?, lo que hace que nopuedas fiarte de no quedarte medio empapado al cabo del rato.tendría que ser totalmente ermético y no dejar salir agua por la parte de abajo.los portes perfectos x amazon.

column4: ergodyne chill-its evaporative cooling vest
column6: j'ai tout de suite essayé ce gilet sous une combinaison de pilote par forte chaleur. humide, il fait un certain poids mais ça ne gêne pas. le contact n'est pas tres agreable mais il est efficace. on sent bien la sensation de fraicheur.attention à ne pas le garder trop longtemps sur soi, sinon rhume garanti !autre inconvénient : il se décolore vite et les vetements en contact peuvent eux se colorer ou décolorer.

column4: ergodyne chill-its evaporative cooling vest
column6: i work at amazon in a warehouse.  it's been really hot lately, so i thought i'd order this just for myself.  i don't do well it high heat and even simple things like walking, i'd break out in an extreme sweat.the vest does work well (but expect drips if you fully soak it for maximum cooling) and dripped on clothing.  it doesn't leak on the inside as that's waterproof, but the water does tend to 'pool' at the bottom of the vest and then drip if really soaked.  i can't have those drips so have to just soak the top half for safety reasons.  it does provide the cooling needed and especially on my bare arms that rub against the vest.  it does cool well.  to maximize the cooling effect, recharge it every 2.5 hours at minimum if you are using cold tap water like i do. (i want to freeze this or use ultra cold water).  if you don't, it gets a very humid feeling, at least for me in a warehouse where temps average 90degrees plus right now.the more you soak it, the better it is.  the colder the water is, the better it is.it does feel heavy.. but only at first.  you get used to it quickly and appreciate the lower temp feeling.  it has made quite a difference in my quality of life chart working in a warehouse.  i wish we used these for all employees.i am happy with my purchase and do recommend it to others with a few cautions as explained above.tho it does feel a bit like wearing a wet t-shirt at times.4/5 stars.

column4: ergodyne chill-its evaporative cooling vest
column6: this thing is a life saver. i was dying on a motorcycle ride out to ottawa last summer with temperatures between 30-35c. i put this on and my temperature instantly dropped. thing is you really must have it exposed to the wind. if you wear it under a jacket, the upper chest part will dry out leaving the bottom permanently moist. the only reason it doesnt get 5 stars is it leaks and the water eventually finds its way to the bottom of the vest where its not cooling much anymore.i bought a medium and it's slightly baggy on me: you want it as tight as comfortable for it to work best. i'm 5'9" around 170lbs.i'm glad this is a part of my permanent motorcycle gear selection.

column4: ergodyne chill-its evaporative cooling vest
column6: arrivato nei tempi previsti. lo uso per turismo sotto un giubbotto da moto con abondanti parti a rete e nel caldo torrido e in viaggio si sente il beneficio.

column4: ergodyne chill-its evaporative cooling vest
column6: i do think they lose their cooling effectiveness as the summer goes on. i notice the vest is considerably lighter, so the little cooling granules are used up or possibly squeezed out by then. i get it as wet as possible and just try to barely squeeze out the excess water so that i don't leave a water trail from the sink to my work site (which is actually my car---i also don't really want my seat soaking wet...just me!). i am a mail carrier so my air conditioner doesn't help much in the summer when we work with the window open. these vests are far superior to the ice vests i was using as i can just carry a bottle of water and refresh it quickly. i carry a 6packsize cooler full of water and just dunk it in there every few hours and keep on moving!

column4: ergodyne chill-its evaporative cooling vest
column6: the 3x is actually quite big. i should have got the 2x for a snug fit. as it is a vest. it gets heavy but worth it.  i put mine in chilled water and then put in deep freezer.it should be noted that this does have a slime feel to it. in 30 degrees of hotness in my workplace the vest deep frozen holds its coolness for about an hour. then i freeze again for 15 minutes.

column4: ergodyne chill-its evaporative cooling vest
column6: positiv : hält was sie verspricht.negativ: wird durch das wasser sehr schwer.verliert das wasser nach und nach wodurch man vom rücken an abwärts komplett nass wird.also eher nichts wenn man sich damit viel bewegen muss.

column4: ergodyne chill-its evaporative cooling vest
column6: je l'ai acheté pour mon père qui travaille dans une usine très chaude ! il aime, ça rafraichit ! je n'y croyais pas, certes c'est pas la clim, mais quand on bosse dehors ou en usine c'est essentiel immpossible de ne pas l'avoir !

column4: ergodyne chill-its evaporative cooling vest
column6: when wet ,  this item is very heavy. it did produce noticeable cooling and i was glad to have it. the size i chose was too large but i ordered the  largest one .

column4: ergodyne chill-its evaporative cooling vest
column6: hallo, eine kühlweste sollte kühlen und das tut sie. die weste ist sehr angenehm zu tragen. die passform entspricht den normalen größen.

column4: ergodyne chill-its evaporative cooling vest
column6: may wan to size down.  this is a great  cooling vest. i had to wear a shirt over it to keep the vest plastered to my body because it was too big when doused in cold water.

column4: ergodyne chill-its evaporative cooling vest
column6: this works!  a bit of trial and error for me (the first few times i did not blot enuf = my clothes got wet, but since i was in my backyard in 100 degree heat, i didnt' care.  for out in public at friend's houses for example, i had to learn how to better blot.  it definitely doesn't get me cold, but it does help keep me cool for about 3 hours in 90+ degree weather.  the only reason i'm not giving it 5 stars (and perhaps i'm just not realistic), i would be ecstatic if this actually got colder than it does.  o well, i'm happy w/ this as i'm not aware of anything else (w/in a reasonable price point) that would do a better job.  o and i recommended this to my dad who preaches as a deacon in a church that while big, doesn't get very cool up in the alter area and he is thrilled too - he wears it over his shirt, but under his vestments (he got the beige color) and says it really helps him.  btw - the customer service for ergodyne (a local company for me) is wonderful - i had a question about sizing and the gal i called in customer service was gracious and extremely helpful!  her advice helped me to choose the right size the 1st time around :)

column4: ergodyne chill-its evaporative cooling vest
column6: being *extremely* sensitive to heat, and working outside these days to rebuild the backyard deck, i had rivers of sweat pouring down my eyes, blinding me in minutes. today, in another 35c heat day, with this vest, i was as cool as a 'the dude' leboswki.on the down side, your clothes will be wet.on the plus side, you will survive the heat !

column4: ergodyne chill-its evaporative cooling vest
column6: excellent product. i'm pretty sure this is the same manufacturer that makes cooling vests for sedici (motorcycle brand) order down a size! i'm 5'9 l and an xl with "slim fit" shirts. i trusted the reviews and ordered down a size.. the medium fit perfectly.it's incredible what a difference this jacket made for me. for my motorcycle people: you need this! it fit perfectly in my suit and did not restrict movement or make me feel uncomfortable. jacket lasts about 40 minutes before you need to toss it back into your ice chest (which is perfect!) make sure it's soaked in water or else your body won't be able to transfer heat to the jacket as efficiently.i was hydrating as frequently as i would with a normal trackday and i could barely break a sweat in 90 degree weather. i didn't wear the jacket for one of the sessions...suddenly i was extremely uncomfortable i had sweat running down my eyes.stop doubting and buy!

column4: ergodyne chill-its evaporative cooling vest
column6: yes, there are probably better options out on the market but, for the price, this vest works as described. i think they are a little larger than posted…l see where folks get them wet and put them in the fridge, before using them. we don’t have that luxury when your riding 450 miles in 100 degree dry heat for 7-8 hours a day. in this type of weather, l was stopping every 3 hours and refuel the bike and rewatering the vest… the lime yellow is very bright and noticeable, good for visibility by others. the vest keeps me alert and comfortable too… well made and affordable..

column4: ergodyne chill-its evaporative cooling vest
column6: high quality materials.  absorbs a lot of water without being heavy or awkward.  holds onto moisture but dries completely. instantly cools the body like jumping into water... so i would day it will buy an hour in the okanagan sun where it is dry but very very hot.

column4: ergodyne chill-its evaporative cooling vest
column6: i use this for woodworking in my garage during the summer in tucson. this plus a bucket of ice water to recharge and a fan works pretty good to stay cool. three stars because it seems to leak some of the gel every time i soak it.

column4: ergodyne chill-its evaporative cooling vest
column6: i was not impressed. wetting the vest down with cold water didn't keep me any cooler. i even went to the extreme and placed it in my freezer. once it was frozen, the coolnest only lasted for about 20 minutes. the vest also adds a few pounds to your burden of having to wear extra weight in the heat. i will be returning it.

column4: ergodyne chill-its evaporative cooling vest
column6: i bought this for my husband who works outside in the texas heat. he tried it a couple of times and doesn't like it. if it's excessively hot, 100+, this really won't help. it might be effective in less hot and humid climates. not a bad product just didn't work for him.

column4: ergodyne chill-its evaporative cooling vest
column6: utilisé pour rouler en moto à des températures >40c.double avantage, ça la peau humidifié dans des zones ultra sec. et ça rafraîchit vraiment l'air porté sous ma veste de moto d'été.attention, comme marqué dans d'autres avis, aux premières utilisation ça peut tâcher (attention au blanc).et ça taille vraiment très grand. ce large équivaut un xxl en europe.

column4: ergodyne chill-its evaporative cooling vest
column6: i thought the vest may have a special absorbent liner between the outer and inner shell, but appears to be only 2 layers of fabric. hence it does weep considerably after being soaked and wrung and the water travels to the lower parts. in retrospect any soaked fabric vest would have the same effect. it does fit well and comfortable and does cool by keeping your t-shirt soaked - which isn't a bad thing when you're sweating anyways.

column4: ergodyne chill-its evaporative cooling vest
column6: nach dem eintauchen in wasser wirkt die weste deutlich nass und gibt die feuchtigkeit nach innen und aussen ab. wechselklamotten mitnehmen..

column4: ergodyne chill-its evaporative cooling vest
column6: te deja todo mojado y terminas resfriado

column4: ergodyne chill-its evaporative cooling vest
column6: husband says it really helped him on his 95 degree plus summer rides!  it was a little heavier than he thought it would be but very valuable for traveling by motorcycle across country.

column6: hubby needed a new jacket.  he didn't have a decent spring/fall option in the closet.i ordered this london fog jacket because i'm a huge fan of the brand.  i wasn't disappointed.  i ordered a large tall because he's 6'4", with a 36 in sleeve.  finding clothes that fit him can be difficult, so i crossed my fingers and hoped for the best.it was a hit!  the jacket, and sleeves, fit beautifully.  it has enough room to wear a sweater under it, without feeling tight, but doesn't look baggy over a lightweight shirt.  the price was excellent, so that was a bonus.london fog has always had a reputation for quality, and its never disappointed me.  i expect him to get several years of use out of this particular purchase.

column4: london fog men's auburn zip-front golf jacket (regular & big-tall sizes), black, 3x-large big
column6: it got real cold in november and i realized my big size parka jacket was falling apart and my windbreaker was too small, especially when i’m carrying my licensed ccw.ordered this in 4xl and a big, fluffy parka in 5xl ( a hunch and i was right, it was junk and didn’t fit at 5xl and back to china it goes )showed up in 2 or 3 days and is nice quality, very roomy, even carrying my glock,,, the parka finally showed up, 8 weeks later— and winter is almost over! damn amazon need to tell the truth about when a product is being mailed from china  and will take months to arrive that is not for this item- it showed up in 2 or 3 days!it is a bit weird in that the lining is loosely attached,, almost like it’s removable. i need to look into it a bit.

column4: london fog men's auburn zip-front golf jacket (regular & big-tall sizes), black, 3x-large big
column6: needed something other than a hoodie.  it doesn't often get cold enough that a hoodie doesn't do it, but my weather resistant nylon shell jacket that i'd had for 20+ years finally needed to go.this is a good one.  sheds rain well enough that i don't get soaked between the truck and wherever i'm going into, it fits right, and it has a ton of pockets.not crazy that it has 2 side pockets on each side, one with a zipper and one without but i just zipped up the zipper pockets and now i don't have to check both pockets when i stick my phone or keys in a side pocket.i'd buy it again and i'm pretty picky.  i have huge shoulders and the sleeves on this one are actually long enough without being stupid long.i'm a little over 6 ft tall, about 270 and most of my height is in my torso.

column4: darcchic mens gothic tailcoat jacket black steampunk vtg victorian coat
column6: i bought this for a costume a few months ago and didn't want to review it until after i've worn it for the event so now i can give a more educated review.i carry all my weight around my waist and i normally use l or xl shirts (90% of my t-shirts are aeropostale so if you fit in a regular us l size that should give you an idea), just to be safe i thought i'd get a xxxl and take it in where needed (easier to remove cloth than add more). as it turns out it fit me just right, so if you're a bigger guy this is definitely not for you. the vest part is not going to forgive any beer belly. that said, there is a reason suits were tailored this way in the past, the coat is cut in a way that it gives a slimming effect around the waist and a bulkier appearance around the shoulders for a nicer v body shape.the coat is a little heavy and thankfully not lined. because it has a wide collar and it has no lining i could wear this and not get too hot despite being a relatively warm day. the coat felt about the same as if i was wearing a sweatshirt. a little warm but nothing unbearable in a late summer heat.the coatails are a little long and i could feel them hit the back of my boots when i took a step, but i have a long stride. if you wear this outdoors you might get mud on your coat if you're not careful (i'm 5'11 for the record) still they look fine and people said they didn't notice i was kicking them nor did they look ridiculously long as i feared.the arms were a bit long for me, when i bring my arms down the cuff came almost to my knuckles, but i can't fault them for that, it's impossible to get a perfect size on people of all shapes and sizes, just note that if you have short arms you may need to roll them a little or trim them. i intended to shorten them but in the end i went against it since i was tipping my hat for pictures and lifting my hands often holding the syringe so i rarely had my hands down for too long.i'm an amateur tailor, i know my way around sewing machines and i can vouch that the workmanship is pretty good, there were just a couple loose threads here and there but they were just leftovers from after they finished stitching and they cut the thread a little long, i just snipped the loose threads and went on my merry way, nothing was loose or at risk of unraveling, the vest "buttons" are actually snap fasteners and they took quite a beating from me test-wearing the outfit several times as more pieces were ready and yet i never had any issues with them.the label specifically said darcchic so i can't confirm my review applies to other lookalike products on amazon.

column6: like many of you reading these reviews, i struggled with determining which size to buy, since individual accounts of the fit vary wildly, from "as expected" to "buy at least two sizes up!" so i thought i'd add a detailed personal account of the size medium. hopefully it helps someone.i'm a male. 5'9", 170 lbs. my build is slim/athletic. not skinny or anything, but fairly slim and i like my clothes the same way. this coat was perfect in medium, which is what i typically wear in everything. the shoulder seam hit right at the corner like it's supposed to (and my shoulders are somewhat broad). when i buttoned up the faux vest - the only way this coat fastens - it was not too tight, not too loose. the tails are dramatic - they hit at the mid-calf.as for the material, as others have stated it's similar to a soft denim. pretty comfy. as a backup i ordered one of those cheap polyester versions of this coat from one of the many generic sellers on here, in case this one didn't fit, but that's going straight back. this one is high quality enough to wear as regular clothes, if i felt like it.oh, and i got it in the burgundy color, which was, well, burgundy. or maroon. purplish-red.very happy with this. i recommend ordering your normal size in shirts if you're pondering this decision as i did.

column4: darcchic mens gothic tailcoat jacket black steampunk vtg victorian coat
column6: i love the look and fit.  the material is denim and is durable.  as coat, the material (denim) does feel a little on the cheap side for this kind of styling.  i would have expected something thicker and of better quality.  with that said, it looks great.  the fit is two sizes small in my opinion.  i wear a large, so i ordered xl, but even that was a bit snug.  i would order two sizes larger if i was to do it again, but the xl works so i'm not going to go through the hassle of returning it and getting the xxl.  i'm 5'7" tall and weight 180 pounds.  i have a slim frame through, but am told, i look solid.  the only thing about the styling that i would change about this coat are the shoulders - they slump.  i expected shoulders to be stiff, straight, and sharp, but when i tried on the coat, they noticeably slump.  nothing too awful, but takes down the look a notch.

column4: darcchic mens gothic tailcoat jacket black steampunk vtg victorian coat
column6: shipping was surprisingly quick. the product is a little "cheaper" looking than we had anticipated. i purchased a large (for a friend) and to see if it would fit him for christmas, i tried it on. it is a bit small. i'm your average american girl (size 7-8 jeans, measurements 39-27-39, weight 145ish) and it was a bit tight around my bust (friend's chest is smaller than mine so should be okay there), but i expected that. the issue was the shoulders. i have kind of broad shoulders for a girl, but this coat i can barely move my arms around.even the sellers size chart is off, so pay attention to the comments and what others have said before you pick a size.secondly, the materials were much cheaper than anticipated. aside from that, everything was fine. the shipping took around 14 days, and coming from china, that's pretty good (amazon claims it takes nearly a month.)

column6: folks it’s tight for women in the chest/front side. i bought a large as men’s large polos swim on me and a medium  men’s polo is “just right”, but in this case, it’s designed for a european or asian framed male which is a “petite” for some americans. the length is right, the shoulders/upper arms tight, and the button front exactly right or slight split/peak-a-boo area in the chest. if you lift weights or bulk up your upper chest, this will be a size constriction challenge for you. if you’re a long distance runner with a lithe frame this might be too big or bulky for you.

column6: i am 5'3" 220lbs and bought the 4xl size in blue. it's a lot bluer in person than in the picture. it fits well for me, since i am heavy set, and am using it for a lefou costume, so i like how long it is on me. however, it smells like airesol spray, moth balls, or a really mildew heavy closet. it stinks !! it smells so bad that when i hung it up (after washing it) it stunk my entire room up!

column4: darcchic mens gothic tailcoat jacket black steampunk vtg victorian coat
column6: the coat arrived ahead of time, to my surprise. it fit me as expected, being that i looked at the actual sizing guide. snaps need a few buttonings and unbuttonings it work well, as with most fresh snaps. superb, denimesque suiting material construction, with good stitching. wouldn't load up the pockets, as location could result in bulging or hanging outside the coat. more for a phone or cards/cash. not really for change. coat is definitely fitted like a suit, so expect the same limited mobility issues that come with looking pimp i.e. not being able to raise your arms above chest/shoulder level (you can still play guitar way up high and dj on a keyboard stand just fine though). not really made for dancing, or constant wear i feel, if this is your look and want to wear it daily it could take it but would need care. considering getting a second one and chopping the sleeves for a more casual throw-over a fishnet/tanktop look. stock it is great for costuming and maybe taking to the club. wouldn't recommend for a formal event, not that kind of tailcoat. it is made for what it is made for and does it well! i use it for gigs and receive frequent compliments, and have used it quite a bit (with moderate abuse) and it has held up just fine. i can also attest to its versatility for those creative in their personal fashion vocabulary. it is best paired with pants of a similar material, but many styles supported here. it can just as easily wear it with a button-up and cravat/bowtie/ascot as i can throw a scarf around it or even rock a printed long sleeve tee and have even ventured to tank top or fishnet shirt. works amazingly with all. i continue to enjoy this product.

column4: darcchic mens gothic tailcoat jacket black steampunk vtg victorian coat
column6: this coat is quite nice for a costume piece. it does run small, so if you think you are a large, get an xl or even xxl. the inner vest is actually part of the coat, not separate, and it buttons with snap buttons, which makes it easy to put on. if you don't like the vest, the vest flaps could be pinned back inside the coat using safety pins, and you can then wear your own vest or waistcoat instead (but you'll need to use safety pins or something else to get the vest flaps out of the way). the pockets are real functioning pockets, although not very deep, but i'm still surprised since so many costume coats just have fake pockets. basically, this coat is a notch above most others costume coats (while still being just a costume coat).

column4: darcchic mens gothic tailcoat jacket black steampunk vtg victorian coat
column6: the size chart and lack of mention that vest is attached are the only reasons i'm giving 4 rather than 5 stars.  the jacket is very well made and the cloth is very sturdy,durable, thick (kind of like a denim or thick duckcloth).  i am female with a large chest and ordered 2 sizes up from the size chart provided by the seller in their description, and it fit absolutely perfectly!  it's a shame you cannot trust their chart though.  for reference, 2 sizes up is a 10"difference in both chest and waist measurements on my body.  i was a little bummed that the vest is sewn to the jacket, but it does help give a beautiful fit.  i personally plan to remove the vest since i need to for the costume design i plan to use this with.  the tails are quite long and fall just below mid-calf on me (from hipbone to floor my leg is 37").

column4: darcchic mens gothic tailcoat jacket black steampunk vtg victorian coat
column6: looks accurate for the period, mostly cotton, and comfortable to wear.

column4: darcchic mens gothic tailcoat jacket black steampunk vtg victorian coat
column6: the fit was great! i'm 5'10, 150lbs and got the small. it fit exactly as i wanted! the tails were not too long for me and the sleeves were just right. however, the jacket is made from a kind of heavy denim-like material so it isn't soft and very nice to the touch like a blazer or sport jacket would be. i was hoping it would have been a bit softer but i suppose that means the jacket will be more rugged and be able to withstand more abuse (not that i'll be trying to find out myself).i bought a separate waist coat to use under it, so i am either going to cut out the jacket's own faux-coat or unsnap the front buttons and pin the two sides back against the inside of the jacket. either option is very easy to do, if you're wondering, so you can either use the jacket with the faux-waist coat or without it.all in all, a decent jacket but the price is a bit high, for me, for what it's made from. the included faux-waistcoat is a nice touch, in case you want something like that and overall it would be a good option for a vampire, magician, goth, steampunk etc. style costume.

column4: darcchic mens gothic tailcoat jacket black steampunk vtg victorian coat
column6: i ordered a size large enough to fit my chest and waist, and the vest fits very tight, but the shoulders were falling off my shoulders and the sleeves hung 3" past my hands! the tails of the coat literally drug on the ground three inches in flat shoes. you have to be very tall and thin to have a chance of getting this fit correctly, in my opinion.

column4: darcchic mens gothic tailcoat jacket black steampunk vtg victorian coat
column6: its a great jacket for the price. i enjoy wearing it but out of all my jackets its not my first choice. the fabric is thinner than i was hoping for but in turn it makes it pliable. the pockets are thin nylon i believe and have a tendency to stick out. do not wear this coat on a windy day, because the sides are fastened to the vest, it blows the lapels away revealing that it is all one jacket which i find embarrassing lol. also the wind will reveal the cheap fabric for the pockets. once again to reiterate this jacket is pretty cool for the price. also the snaps easily come undone and because i work out, my pecs pop the top snap off constantly lol.

column4: darcchic mens gothic tailcoat jacket black steampunk vtg victorian coat
column6: i'm a slender guy with no muscle whatsoever -- 30" waist, 34" chest, 28" sleeve, about 135 pounds, 6 foot tall -- so if i went by the measurements provided in the coat description, a small would be more than big enough for me. after reading the other reviews, though, i went a size up and got a medium. it fits well in the chest but the sleeve are no where near long enough. if i keep my arms down, the sleeves end at my wrists with no slack to spare. if i raise my arms, the sleeves end at about the middle of my forearms. the material and overall quality, however, is very good. others are correct that the material feels like a very durable denim or canvas. it's not too stiff, though, in my opinion. i would have given this coat 5 stars but because of the sleeves i had to give it 3. i would return it for a large coat instead but i need this for halloween and it's currently not prime eligible.

column4: darcchic mens gothic tailcoat jacket black steampunk vtg victorian coat
column6: even though i ordered the jacket two sizes larger (xl) than my normal size (med) it was still a bit tight. i should have ordered three sizes larger than my norm. i have to get help from my wife or someone else to get my right arm into it after i have inserted my left arm. so, i sprayed it with water and put it on and wore it till it dried on me. now it is much better.the jacket is a nice cut and fashionable. there is no lining in the jacket. i would have paid a few bucks more for a lining. a lining in a jacket like that protects the inner fabric and also facilitates a more comfortable experience. it is also easier to slip in and out of with a lining. unlined heavy material is kinda grabby to other fabrics.

column6: i did a lot of research on different websites looking for a vest that i could wear while ranching, fishing, or just for casual wear. needless to say, prices vary considerably but not necessarily commensurate with quality. i initially found this vest on legendary whitetails' website and was impressed by its looks, style  and functionality. when i finally pulled the trigger to purchase it, to my dismay it was sold out in my size. however, i found the same, exact vest available on amazon in my size (l) and immediately bought it.when i received the vest, i was very pleased to see that its style, appearance and quality met, if not exceeded my expectations. with its flannel lining, it's comfortable and warm but not too heavy. i'm 6' and weigh 175 lbs. and typically wear a size large in most apparel. from a sizing standpoint, i would say that this vest fits true to size (always a concern when ordering online).in summary, i am very pleased with this vest. really good quality at a very fair price.

column6: i wear a medium so i bought a large to be roomy.  well it is a tight fit w/o a tshirt and too tight with a shirt.  best to wear it w/o anything underneath. naked.  not my choice so i went back to buy one that is 1-2 sizes bigger than their :large, maybe an xl or a xxl.  it looks great and thin with great pockets but too small. did not stretch much.  vests normally go over something so these should be bigger to accommodate a shirt or something inside it.  so order bigger.

column4: gihuo men's golf lightweight photo vest fishing travel safari vest
column6: i'm satisfied with it for the moment. my main complaints are it's a bit high priced for the quality of the materials, and it's not as comfortable as i'd hoped it would be; the material's a bit scratchy. that being said, it's light, which is good for summer walks (my intended use), and it fits pretty much right on the money. would i purchase again? eh...

column4: gihuo men's golf lightweight photo vest fishing travel safari vest
column6: this item is well made and as described in photos. the zippers appeared to be slightly “underweight” for rigorous outdoor activity but problem free for everyday use. i returned it because while xl usually fits me comfortably, this item was undersized. i purchased a xxl which fit fine. it also extends past the waist to the lower hips so fit is important if you’ll be sitting with it zippered up. also this vest isn’t insulated so it won’t be similar in function to a light sweater or outdoor fleece vests. in warmer climates & seasons it would be fine. overall a good value for a lightweight vest.

column4: gihuo men's golf lightweight photo vest fishing travel safari vest
column6: this review refers specifically to the basic model with three outside zipper pockets.  i placed four orders to finally get one of acceptable size.  i wear size l for shirts, vests and jackets of almost all brands. i ordered this guiho vest in size l and received a size s in a package labeled l; the size tag had been cut out.  i ordered l again (in a different color) and received size m in a package labeled l; again no size tag.  a size xxl was too big.  finally a size xl was satisfactory, though a bit too large.  so i have not seen a true size l.  both the xxl and the xl had size tags.  i think the seller ran out of size l and so deceptively put smaller sizes in packages labeled l. colors are not as pictured: the “army green” is an ugly dark greenish brown; kakhi is more yellowish brown than shown, but satisfactory.  the overall quality seems satisfactory, though i have not yet tested it for durability.  it is annoying that the zipper pull is on the left side.  the one inside pocket in the xl is barely big enough to hold a us passport; pockets are smaller in smaller sizes.  follow up:  the vest gave satisfactory service for a week of traveling abroad.  my main complaint is about the deceptive sizing.  it could be improved by adding a large inside pocket big enough to carry a kindle or a travel guide book.

column4: gihuo men's golf lightweight photo vest fishing travel safari vest
column6: i almost always wear a vest over a shirt or t-shirt as a "fat- hider". i have a green one i like, but decided to get a second one. the one i originally bought on amazon is not for sale anymore. i don't need a dozen pockets, just one for glasses and two side pockets for keys, etc. this vest has that. i originally bought a khaki one, but decided i didn't like the color on me so am returning. i replaced it with a gray one of the same mfr as the khaki.no mileage so far to address durability. the reverse zipper is odd, but i have that on a down coat from france, and i don't zip up very often anyway.

column4: gihuo men's golf lightweight photo vest fishing travel safari vest
column6: i love this style and color. it's light and airy and keeps you cool while looking like a camper. also it's got pockets.

column4: gihuo men's golf lightweight photo vest fishing travel safari vest
column6: on the plus side. it fits good, works great as a kind of winder breaker for the body. looks great too. the cell phone pocket on the left chest is actually the right size to fit a smart phone. other vests i have tried were obviously made for old smaller cell phones and too small for modern smart phones. now the bad. the nylon shell is very thin and not very rugged. i have only had this a short time and there is already a small hole right over the cell phone pocket. the nylon is so fragile that all you have to do is rub up against something while you have a cell phone in the pocket and it wears a hole in the nylon almost immediately. so on the one hand i want to recommend this for all the good points, but at the same time discourage people from getting it due to the fragility of the materials.

column4: zenthace men's warm sherpa lined fleece plaid flannel shirt jacket(all sherpa fleece lined)
column6: i live in a area of southern australia that is hot, hot, hot in summer and very cold in winter. this jacket is perfect for our cold nights which are around around freezing. would not suit artic temperatures. having said that i am very pleased with this jacket. it is a perfect fit, warm but it will still allow for layering and it has the bonus of side pockets which not all jackets of this type possess. delivery process was super fast (order placed 11 july and received today 22nd) and having free returns gives peace of mind. (i have ordered a different brand jacket as well as this and sizing was guesswork with much disagreement in reviews about fit.) so if you are thinking of buying this jacket, order the size you usually take and i'd be amazed if you didn't like your purchase.

column4: zenthace men's warm sherpa lined fleece plaid flannel shirt jacket(all sherpa fleece lined)
column6: i was worried this might be cheap junk but boy was i wrong, very good quality garment, and very warm without being bulky, ill be buying more for next winter thats for sure.

column4: zenthace men's warm sherpa lined fleece plaid flannel shirt jacket(all sherpa fleece lined)
column6: innanzitutto l'articolo corrisponde perfettamente alla descrizione, cosa assolutamente non scontata.l'esterno è in pile super morbido, l'interno una pelliccetta sintetica anch'essa estremamente morbida.i colori rispecchiano la foto dell' inserzione: io ho preso un tono su tono di grigi ed è una combinazione molto gradevole che non fa sembrare la camicia un prodotto da bancarella cinese.il taglio è regolare e non fa l'effetto "sacco di patate" ma piuttosto segue la forma del corpo; corretta la lunghezza delle maniche.attenzione alle misure: veste grande. io sono 1.75 per circa 80 kg con fisico robusto e la taglia giusta è la m.le tasche per le mani sono ampie e all' interno rivestite in caldo pile.le tasche frontali sono piuttosto piccole.è un capo caldo ma non caldissimo: per temperature attorno allo zero bisogna mettere in conto almeno una termica sotto e un giubbotto sopra. è una camicia pesante, non una giacca imbottita.soddisfatto dell' acquisto.

column4: zenthace men's warm sherpa lined fleece plaid flannel shirt jacket(all sherpa fleece lined)
column6: i purchased two different versions of this by the same brand. the only difference is this one is a button front and the other one is a snap front. same exact quality, material and fit. very soft inside. good quality material. it's not thin junk. one thing i found interesting that you need to take into consideration is that amazon suggested that i wear a large in this model yet the exact same thing with the snap front they suggested i wear a medium. i ordered large in both and both fit perfectly. i can see the button closure being nice for a shirt but i found that the snap is much more convenient for a jacket for a quick on and off. this one was $10 cheaper but i would rather pay the extra money for the snap in the future. the only negative about the whole thing is the hip pockets are set back too far so it makes them difficult to reach in quickly. you have to feel around towards the back to find & reach them. it was a good buy. hard to find insulated flannels anymore. these kept me warm in 30 temperatures. perfect fall or early winter jacket.

column6: hola, la adquirí en primavera 2023, ya con algo de calor, espere a que bajara un poco y así fue que la compre; cabe mencionar que mido 1.70, peso 68 kilos, poca panza y hombros caídos, pedí talla chica, al ponérmela me quedo ligeramente grande (menos que talla m), pensé de inmediato, la mando ajustar y listo!, pero viendo que no es tan caliente, mejor poniéndome debajo una camiseta (algodón o térmica), camisa y un suéter o sudadera, me quedaría mejor y lucio mucho mejor; al tacto por fuera y por dentro se sienten muy ricas, mi preocupación que encogiera por ser como franela por fuera y para nada (la lave dos veces para verificar) y aparte no se arruga y casi no es necesario plancharle, cabe mencionar que donde vivo es toluca méx, el invierno es rudo y si pienso salir con una camisa y la chamarra la pasaría mal. si usas prendas talla chica en la marca dockers, rl o tommy (todas regular), te quedara bien, o como a mi ligeramente pero muy ligero grande; en mi caso no fue problema porque a veces así vienen las sudaderas tipo chamarra. lo único malo es que se nota que para ahorrar en la maquila, las bolsas están a la altura de la costura de las costillas y eso da como resultado que están atrás las bolsas, pero de allí en fuera se acepta la prenda. me volvería a comprar siiiiii, en mi caso sería en colores sobrios y lisos, están padres la tipo leñador pero cada quien sus gustos.

column6: i work in a refrigerated warehouse but don't need long sleeves under it, and i hate the feeling of the typical nylon lining in most sleeves. this is the perfect solution to that, i can throw it on over a t shirt without needing a buffer layer. the colours look great (photographed against a hi-viz safety vest), it's soft, i don't have any immediate concerns about durability, but i'd probably buy it again just for the sleeves if something did happen to it.

column4: zenthace men's warm sherpa lined fleece plaid flannel shirt jacket(all sherpa fleece lined)
column6: i absolutely love this coat. leaving it open, it breathes enough that in mild weather it never feels overly warm. as soon as you button it up though it creates an incredibly cozy little bubble of your body heat. the only downside is the pockets. they feel a bit far back when buttoned up, but on the inside, there is only a small string connecting the bottom of the pocket to the coat. i could see it very easily getting snagged on something and once torn, the pocket will likely sag below the bottom of the jacket and look silly. i think in a future edition, it would be wise to sew the pocket onto the inside of the coat somehow. it would really make it feel much higher quality.

column4: cutter & buck clique men's summit full-zip microfleece
column6: it’s a great value. it is, hands down, the absolute, most average fabric and the cut is extremely middle of the road, but it’s essentially exactly what i wanted. you’ll love it. i bought it to fit under a denim trucker jacket and/or to be used as a house jacket. it’s great for either. i am 6’2” and about 190 and the medium is the right size for me. i first bought a large and it was really loose on me. amazon has a pre-configured return protocol for people who buy the wrong size, so they already put the medium in the mail before i had wrapped up the large to be returned. very efficient. the medium arrived with an air freshener fragrance, which i assume is what they do when someone returns one and they plan to send it back out. the large had no smell. i just washed it before wearing; you have to admire that they have such a robust system for returns. they can’t just throw them out because they didn’t fit. i’ll probably buy another one since it doesn’t make sense to have a sweatshirt that you’d use to wear around the house and out on the mean streets of suburbia.
