column4: cutter & buck clique men's summit full-zip microfleece
column6: as advertised and well made. not too heavy. good for hiking in cold weather.

column4: cutter & buck clique men's summit full-zip microfleece
column6: the quality of the piece is very good and what was expected. the size did run small compared to a previous same labeled fleece purchased previously. however, the sleeves are at at least 4.5 - 5" too long!absurdly long and totally disproportionate to the size. had to have it tailored which will make me think twice about future purchases from amazon essentials.

column4: cutter & buck clique men's summit full-zip microfleece
column6: i have only worn it a few times, but it’s a nice fit. i wanted something to use as almost a sweater, to throw on for a chilly morning or a restaurant with the a/c too high. it works perfectly for those conditions.

column4: cutter & buck clique men's summit full-zip microfleece
column6: i've tried 6 different zipper sweaters, and began to wonder if i was just too crazy-fussy.  this has reassured me of my sanity!  this is what i wanted.  it is soft, particularly important around the neck when the sweater has a full-length zipper.  the xl size was perfect for me (190 lbs, 6 foot, average build, with a medium-weight shirt or sweatshirt underneath.  it has a good waist length (as pictured in the ad) and good circumference for me (i have a 38" waist).  the sleeves are not overly long; rolled up once at the cuffs was perfect.  blue color was a dark navy blue.  the zipper was sturdy, and pulls up on the right side.  (several of the sweaters i tried were described as "men's" but the zipper pulled up on the left, woman's, side by u.s. custom.)  it is medium weight, so i can wear it around the house or outside if i feel a bit chilly.  it is not really warm or heavy for colder weather.  it has two deep zipper pockets. the price of $25 was very reasonable.  yes, i'm happy i found this.  i will follow the washing instructions (machine wash cold; dry low) because i want this to last.

column4: cutter & buck clique men's summit full-zip microfleece
column6: just right for going to ac restaurants and church.

column4: cutter & buck clique men's summit full-zip microfleece
column6: bought this jacket for my husband. he is about 6 ft & weighs 350, typically wears a 3xlt. i struggle to find anything with the right length & width, especially jackets. i covered my bases & ordered a 3x & 4x to see what would fit best since reviews & size chart were not helpful. i ended up sending the 3x back because the 4x fits more like a 3x. so this jacket definitely runs on the smaller side. the length isn’t bad, for most it would seem average length and material is light but warm. the husband is happy with his new jacket & it’s his favorite color.

column4: cutter & buck clique men's summit full-zip microfleece
column6: not only does this run so small that it is tight on me, it also has a seam around the collar that is like a strip of sandpaper rubbing against my neck which makes it totally uncomfortable to wear! i have returned this item.

column4: cutter & buck clique men's summit full-zip microfleece
column6: liked the navy color.

column4: cutter & buck clique men's summit full-zip microfleece
column6: just love it's very nice

column4: cutter & buck clique men's summit full-zip microfleece
column6: this is exactly what i was looking for. it is necessary to wear though with collared shirts because of the discomfort related to the fabric strip around the neck.

column4: cutter & buck clique men's summit full-zip microfleece
column6: fits well, very comfortable.

column4: cutter & buck clique men's summit full-zip microfleece
column6: i bought this fleece for my 14 year old son to wear to school and he loves it. it’s light but it keeps him warm.

column4: cutter & buck clique men's summit full-zip microfleece
column6: i ordered a medium but it was a little too tight so i exchanged it for a large and it fits great. no problem with the exchange had new one in a couple of days. i love it lightweight but keeps you warm. i get colder easier now that i am getting cancer treatments and i carry this all the time so if i get cold or just too chilly i put it on and feel great.

column4: cutter & buck clique men's summit full-zip microfleece
column6: as a "sweatshirt," i had expected the fabric to be different.  it's hard to find a sweatshirt with zipper pockets that isn't a hoody.  this is a very lightweight "fleece" that's moderately warm -- unless the wind is blowing.  it doesn't stop much of the wind -- so you'll probably need something long sleeve underneath.

column4: cutter & buck clique men's summit full-zip microfleece

column4: cutter & buck clique men's summit full-zip microfleece

column4: cutter & buck clique men's summit full-zip microfleece

column4: dickies men's diamond quilted nylon vest
column6: i purchased this vest for my husband who has been working outdoors on  a construction site. i did purchase one size bigger so it would fit comfortably overtop of a undershirt, t-shirt and a  thick hoodie. could probably even fit overtop of his light jacket. the vest has large wide open arm holes so i guess it was actually designed to fit overtop of a light jacket..this vest is very well made. the back of it goes a bit lower i guess to cover some of the lower back  &  butt area. the front pouch style pockets are wide and deep and fleece lined.. would easily fit a phone and other items. the inside lining is lightly padded and lining is a soft t-shirt type fabric that likely holds body heat. the outer shell of the vest is a thicker type of nylon that likely breaks wind. the zipper is sturdy and seems to be good quality zipper. the fabrics have that quilted stitching. my husband likes it very much and says its the best vest he has ever had / worn..very well made. well worth every penny. made in bangledesh - no not  cheap china made.i would purchase again and recommend this vest for anyone who needs a good vest for working outdoors.

column4: dickies men's diamond quilted nylon vest

column4: dickies men's diamond quilted nylon vest

column4: dickies men's diamond quilted nylon vest

column6: roomy as i like.

column4: dickies men's diamond quilted nylon vest
column6: light dickies vest that has some deep but not too deep front pockets. warm enough to wear casually around the house or during the spring/ fall seasons. i purchased mine at xxl so i could add layers underneath. collar is akin to a flight jacket. one minor gripe was the lower part of the zipper was loose from the vest which was easily remedied with some thread and needle.

column4: pro club fleece lined windbreaker jacket
column6: originally i ordered a large size jacket being that i am a size medium. i was going with the rule “always go one size up with jackets and coats”.  with these jackets, i would not use that rule at all.  the jacket was way too big on me and i had i return this hack via ups and get a refund minus the shipping cost.now that i have this medium size jacket, it fits almost how expected the jacket to fit.  the chest area could be a little wider, but over all, i like it.now i live in central texas, it might get as cold as 30 degrees fahrenheit, but normally not colder than that.  it keeps me warm.  it breaks the wind quite well too.  it rained today, it held up pretty good and i stayed dry.  however, i was only going from my house or store to my car.now i’m originally from the northeastern part of the u.s.  it’s colder there and we get snow.  i would use this jacket as a spring or fall jacket in a colder climate.

column4: pro club fleece lined windbreaker jacket
column6: 5xl 250lb, 5’8”, great fit, very roomy. perfect weight for socal winters, nice soft lining. we’ll constructed. happy with jacket.

column4: pro club fleece lined windbreaker jacket
column6: material not what i expected when i open the package, but it does keep you warm and looks good wearing it.

column4: pro club fleece lined windbreaker jacket
column6: the jacket is as advertised, but the zipper is on the wrong side.  my wife didn't know what i was talking about until i showed her my other coats and her coats. men's zippers are on the right-hand side and women's the left.  this jacket has a left-hand zipper.  now the zipper works just fine. the coat seems well constructed, but it just feels wrong when i go to zip or unzip.i would have given it 5 stars, but the zipper thing is a standard that has been on every man's coat or jacket i have ever had.

column4: pro club fleece lined windbreaker jacket
column6: the coat cost 50.00 & i paid 72.00 due to shipping! not happy about that.

column4: pro club fleece lined windbreaker jacket
column6: i am roughly 5'11" and would wear a 3xl t-shirt.. the upper back is pretty tight for me and so is the chest and stomach area but that could be just an issue of me being a bigger guy and shaped different. it did do its job as a windbreaker and it also did keep me warm. the whole reason why i am writing this though other than the size issue that others have warned about, which is resolved if you buy one size larger. is the problem with warranty and support. i reached out to pro club through their website for support after the jacket ripped and the rep said they didnt' offer support for their products sold on amazon. even if you were to look at their website it looks like there isn't any warranty available on their products. i was just outside of the return policy as well. if you can get these jackets for cheap then i would say go for it but otherwise i'd stay away.pros:- keeps you warm- does its job as a windbreakercons:- smaller than advertised size[buy one size larger]- no warranty outside of return policy

column4: pro club fleece lined windbreaker jacket
column6: liked the fit very much.  the lining was very nice, too.

column4: pro club fleece lined windbreaker jacket
column6: while i will get lots of use out of this jacket here in austin, tx.  the fleece lining is actually slightly excessive.

column4: pro club fleece lined windbreaker jacket
column6: i ordered the 5xl big and tall, the 5xl was not branded tall anywhere on it. i wear a 4xlt shirt. bought the next size up due to description saying it run small. jacket fits like a 3xl jacket. imagine the jacket as the sausage jacket and me as the stuffing, all of my glorious lumps and mounds highlighted for the world to see.yes zipper is on the left, it’s mentioned in the description, big whoop.in the description it said made in usa, tag clearly says made in china.

column4: pro club fleece lined windbreaker jacket
column6: this is  the second such jacket i bought. the first jacket's left side pocket was left unfinished/unsewn . one's hand goes through the pocket because the bottom of the pocket was not sewn closed. luckily, i can sew, so i went ahead and completed the work so i could have a pocket i could actually use. this is the only reason why i took off one star from the rating. the jacket is actually well made and the material is good. the fit is even better. i sized up because i like a loose jacket. i am a size 4 miss, but i ordered a medium. i like the jacket so much, i ordered a second one and the second one is perfect. the jacket is very comfortably warm.

column4: pro club fleece lined windbreaker jacket
column6: technically a "lined windbreaker", but actually warmer than those words imply.  i really like the fit and the style/look, this is my go-to outer wear for everything except the coldest of weather.

column4: pro club fleece lined windbreaker jacket
column6: this jacket is a little thinner than i thought it was going to be because the sleeves don't have the inner layer of warmth/ fleece lined. other than that it is good.

column4: pro club fleece lined windbreaker jacket
column6: i ordered this jacket for my father. the only complaint he has is that the zipper is on the opposite side from any jacket he currently owns so it makes it difficult to zip up. he also has some vision impairment and that makes it a little more difficult. otherwise, the jacket is warmer than the one he currently owned and it meets the need.

column4: pro club fleece lined windbreaker jacket
column6: i like the fleece lining not to hot and not cold. i got this jacket to wear to work on them not to cold days because i work the loading docks and it was just what i was looking for. years ago you used to be able to buy these jackets in store but not anymore that's the downside of ordering online you can't see it in person but like i said it's just what i was looking for

column4: pro club fleece lined windbreaker jacket
column6: good quality for the price, comfortable, nice fall jacket as well.

column4: pro club fleece lined windbreaker jacket
column6: i had to order xl for the longer arms. leaves my middle with a little extra material fat belly space for me. the hoodie could fit a large head & probably a baseball cap. as is it covers my eyes if i want. but overall a decent jacket. i just don't understand the gay reversing of the front zipper like on women's clothing.

column4: pro club fleece lined windbreaker jacket
column6: bought this for my son who is 6'6" and weighs around 270. normally he wears a xxl but after reading reviews i ordered 3xl - it is a perfect fit. it is a nice weight for spring !

column4: pro club fleece lined windbreaker jacket
column6: the first clue that something is amiss with this jacket is that the zipper pull is on the left side.  this is extremely unusual for men's clothing which normally buttons or zips from the right, but women's clothing usually fastens from the left.  the proportions are also a bit screwy, particularly the shoulders which were too tight.  women tend to have narrower shoulders than men.  it's almost as if they took a jacket pattern that was made for women and just scaled up the size to fit men rather than redesign the jacket from scratch.

column4: pro club fleece lined windbreaker jacket
column6: the zipper is reversed which may make it difficult for some people to engage and zip......if you are use to the zipper connector being on the right side, don't buy this jacket.....the zipper connector is on the left side.....weird.

column4: pro club fleece lined windbreaker jacket
column6: not made in usa

column4: pro club fleece lined windbreaker jacket
column6: i love everything

column4: pro club fleece lined windbreaker jacket
column6: let me be clear, the reason the jacket is too small is because it's not a windbreaker. it has the flannel lining on the inside which took up the extra space, that would make it a windbreaker.at this point it's no longer a windbreaker, because of its flannel lining it's a jacket and they did not increase the size to accommodate for the flannel which makes it too small, because it's not a windbreaker,  i know of no windbreaker with a thick lining in my lifetime of 55 years. and i have purchased many windbreakers.

column4: pro club fleece lined windbreaker jacket
column6: it was a gift for my hubby to play golf in

column4: pro club fleece lined windbreaker jacket
column6: ordered one for myself and one for husband.  loved the jackets -- windy where we walk and sometimes after dark.  mine broke where the zipper pull slides, completely broke out 2nd time i put it on.  returned for credit with no problem.  finally decided to try again.  husband loves his.  it had one problem which turned out to be fine.  the hang tag said 2x, but sewn in tag said 3x.  definitely a 3x and works fine. gives him a little space to layer. would give 5 star if hadn't had problem.

column4: pro club fleece lined windbreaker jacket
column6: this was the second one i ordered for my husband.  bought a smaller one first and it didn't fit my husband, so i gave that one to our son.  i ordered the same jacket in a size larger as my husband had put on weight and this one fit just fine and he loves this jacket.  he wore it through most of the winter.  with the lining and the hood it kept him warmer than i expected a windbreaker to do.  i will try to find a lighter weight one now that spring is here and we will soon be into summer.  very pleased with this purchase.

column4: pro club fleece lined windbreaker jacket
column6: the material is excellent but waist area is restricting

column4: pro club fleece lined windbreaker jacket
column6: good fit and great windbreaker would buy again!

column4: pro club fleece lined windbreaker jacket
column6: keeps me warm in a freezer pulling orders the seam at the armpit did tear though will need to fix or replace

column4: pro club fleece lined windbreaker jacket
column6: after receiving the item a day later than promised, i didn't pay close enough attention to the zipper location since it said it was a men's jacket, which all men's clothing has the zipper handle on the right side. the jacket fit nicely, except the zipper issue. if you don't want the zipper on the left side, then i would not buy this.

column4: pro club fleece lined windbreaker jacket
column6: it’s what i expected as far as style, you know the simple casual but neat look to it that i like about the pro club brand. it’s quite comfortable like i expected. it’s not really built for warmth but i would say as long as you have meat on your bones you’ll be comfortable in 50-65 degree weather, that’s an estimate from a person who lives in a hot environment. not disappointed because i expected it to be light. i do still wish it was a little heavier though. beats any typical windbreaker with no insulation.

column4: pro club fleece lined windbreaker jacket
column6: this was a gift. normally they wear a 4x but i decided to go up a size to give a little extra room. glad i did. this runs alittle small. it fit great everywhere but when they went to zip it up. it was tight. still kept it due to how great the overall quality of the jacket was.

column4: pro club fleece lined windbreaker jacket
column6: the zipper tab is on the left side so think it’s a women’s jacket. no one can tell but me so no big deal. fits just right but i could have ordered an xxl and been satisfied. i use it at my security job and feel confident it will keep me warm when the temp drops to the 40’s and has enough room for a liner for extra warmth. i would buy it again.

column4: pro club fleece lined windbreaker jacket
column6: the jacket appeared to be well made light windbreaker.  unfortunately, i returned it because the sleeves were not lined (they were lightly quilted, but not fleece lined).  size was perfect, easy movement while wearing it. received the product in a timely fashion.  credit on the return appeared the day i sent it back.

column4: pro club fleece lined windbreaker jacket

column4: pro club fleece lined windbreaker jacket

column4: pro club fleece lined windbreaker jacket

column6: nice looking softshell jacket.  a little warmer than my old columbia windbreaker.  the xl jacket fit is as described, however a little tight in the chest (i have a 49" chest) as i am short and stocky.  the sleeves have adjustable cuffs via velcro straps.  i especially love the extra chest pocket perfect for phones.  be careful of the main zipper coming apart at the bottom if you try to zip up too fast.  otherwise i really like this jacket.

column4: trailside supply co. men's softshell fleece-lined jackets/winter outdoor coats/windbreaker/medium-weight water-repellent

column4: trailside supply co. men's softshell fleece-lined jackets/winter outdoor coats/windbreaker/medium-weight water-repellent
column6: the jacket fits just a bit too snug for me. i like the jacket overall, but wish it was just a tad looser. i will probably keep it, even though it is a bit tight. i would have given 5 stars if the fit was better.

column4: trailside supply co. men's softshell fleece-lined jackets/winter outdoor coats/windbreaker/medium-weight water-repellent
column6: i was looking for a plain jacket to use for my aemt class and the clinicals i need to take for it. and given it is winter here i needed a jacket quick. this is lightweight and soft on the outside and very easy to move around in. no pulling on my shoulders or upper arms like other jackets do. plenty of space in the pockets to carry my things like my stethoscope, pens, medications, and back up supplies i need to have close to me when i travel out that will not clutter up my go bag.the velcro tightening pieces on the wrists are stretchy enough for me to pull my sleeves up  on my arms incase i need to keep cloth out of the way for what i need to do. with the pockets it is a bit higher up on my torso,the bottom of the pocket the zipper did cut my fingertip and through the white of my fingernail when i pushed my  hand into the pocket to grab something. it may have been my fault on that but i wanted to make note of that . overall i love this jacket and i hope it will last a long time during my school into my job life. and i can even wear it as a regular jacket by removing my velcro patches from my shoulders.

column4: trailside supply co. men's softshell fleece-lined jackets/winter outdoor coats/windbreaker/medium-weight water-repellent
column6: going through all the jackets available to choose from was quite a chore.  i narrowed my list down to this jacket and the columbia ascender softshell jacket (https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/b00hq4ksmi).  they seemed pretty similar although the columbia jacket was $11 more expensive.  i decided to order both and then choose.these jackets are virtually identical.  here's the differences i spotted:1. the cuff on this trailside jacket has elastic as well as velco cuff.  the columbia jacket just has the velcro.  the problem with only the velcro cuff is that you either strap and unstrap the velcro whenever you put it on and take it off, or you live with the cuff wide enough to get it on and off and accept it the cold air from the poor fit when you wear it.  the combination of velcro and elastic cuff on this jacket solves this problem.2. the zipper on the columbia jacket was quite stiff.  so stiff that you need to use two hands to zip or unzip it.  the trailside jacket has an easy smooth zipper.3. the emblem.  the columbia jacket has their name emblazoned, whereas the trailside emblem looks like the edge of a mountain ridge.4. the trailside comes in a "ziplock" like bag.  the columbia in a thinner resealable bag (making it awkward to get the jacket in and out past the sticky edges).5. the price of the trailside is better.

column4: trailside supply co. men's softshell fleece-lined jackets/winter outdoor coats/windbreaker/medium-weight water-repellent
column6: i needed a lightweight jacket for fall and spring, and the trailside brand doesn't disappoint. i'm not trying to make a fashion statement, just needed something to keep out the chill and serve as a shell in wind/light rain. this jacket does this perfectly.

column6: very nice jacket for the price. just what i was looking for. mid-weight for cool days. probably not sufficient for winter but perfect for spring and fall. very soft and lots of pockets etc. i'm thinking of buying a second one just to have a back up!

column4: trailside supply co. men's softshell fleece-lined jackets/winter outdoor coats/windbreaker/medium-weight water-repellent
column6: fit as expected, but one of the inside pockets was ripped a little, and i am not the person who has time to resend things normally.  thankfully a tailor in town repaired it at a fair price, but i really wish the pockets were much stronger from the start.  the hand pockets are not as large as i was expecting and could not fit my beats headphones case.  there are a couple pockets on the inside that work with it though.  the short answer, would i buy it again?  yes.  it's seems to be very well,  i just really wish the pockets were reinforced better.  the pocket in question was the top zipper pocket.  it had a hole in its corner on the inside, letting things drop through it.  it's a very essential pocket to me, which is another reason i had it repaired asap.

column4: trailside supply co. men's softshell fleece-lined jackets/winter outdoor coats/windbreaker/medium-weight water-repellent
column6: i like this as an everyday, around town jacket. the cuffs are great, with velcro and elastic they are tight and easy to get on and off. i got the lined one and it is warm, but not too warm--comfortable for 40-60 f. at this price and weight it is not an extreme weather jacket--i would not want to go work or play in the fields on a cold day (windy and < 45f) in this jacket.

column4: trailside supply co. men's softshell fleece-lined jackets/winter outdoor coats/windbreaker/medium-weight water-repellent

column4: trailside supply co. men's softshell fleece-lined jackets/winter outdoor coats/windbreaker/medium-weight water-repellent
column6: my husband needed this for work. it fit perfect and keeps him nice and warm for our “mild” texas winter-its cold to us.  he was also able to have some patches sewed on to be able to wear at work and it’s water resistant in case it rains!

column4: trailside supply co. men's softshell fleece-lined jackets/winter outdoor coats/windbreaker/medium-weight water-repellent

column4: trailside supply co. men's softshell fleece-lined jackets/winter outdoor coats/windbreaker/medium-weight water-repellent
column6: in general i like the fit, feel and weight.  but there are no chest pockets.  there is no good place for a cell phone/wallet or etc.  the upper arm pockets are ok.  the lower back "map" pocket is ok.  but there is no chest pocket which is a really glaring deficiency.  the liner of the hand pockets is stitched on the inside (on both sides of the jacket) in such a way as to make a very deep very narrow pocket where the inside chest pocket should be.  but this is so deep and narrow as to be virtually useless.  a small phone or small wallet could fit inside but getting anything other than a very small hand in there to dig it out would require a near contortionist.  too bad because otherwise i would be really happy with this jacket.

column4: trailside supply co. men's softshell fleece-lined jackets/winter outdoor coats/windbreaker/medium-weight water-repellent
column6: i love this jacket!! i never take the time to to do reviews but i seriously felt like it was necessary with this one. it needed a few shrinks in the wash and dryer to get it to my specific liking as far as a more snug fit since it is a men’s jacket, but besides that.. no complaints really. when i first zipped it up when i tried it on, the zipper did a weird thing and split on me.. but it only happened once and i’m hoping it doesn’t do it again. so far it hasn’t. seems like this jacket is made of pretty good quality for the price. i dig it. oh, i do recommend that you buy a size up (that was the jacket can last longer anyway) though. i did, and i’m really grateful for it because it can begin to shrink after a few drys if you use high heat like i do.

column4: dickies men's big-tall sanded sherpa lined hooded jacket

column4: dickies men's big-tall sanded sherpa lined hooded jacket
column6: love the coat, hate the size. i bought, tried, and returned a 3x-tall, and a 5x-regular. 3x was too small, and the sleeves were too short. 5x was too large and the sleeves were the same length as the 3x. if you have long arms, be wary.  also, don't rip open the package that it comes in thinking it's going to fit like i did. now i have to buy something to return the first coat in. i was careful with the second coat packaging, so i can use that for the return of the 2nd.

column4: dickies men's big-tall sanded sherpa lined hooded jacket

column4: dickies men's big-tall sanded sherpa lined hooded jacket
column6: wow! this jacket is really heavy and certainly keeps you warm. being in the south it actually is a bit too heavy. but is great for the few weeks we have of bitter cold weather.

column4: dickies men's big-tall sanded sherpa lined hooded jacket
column6: jacket is exactly how it was described.

column4: dickies men's big-tall sanded sherpa lined hooded jacket
column6: this jacket has a great classic look and has kept me warm working in the 20s the last week. i've already received several compliments on the jacket's appearance and warmth. the elastic-free waist line looks better and is more comfortable than elastic. the sleeves and waist in size large tall are long enough for my longish arms and torso. the hood is bigger than that of any coat i've owned before and keeps out the wind very effectively. the zipper is solid and joins the hood at the top to cover your chin. the duck outer has apparently been very thoroughly "sanded" and is softer than those of other duck jackets i've owned. i believe it is still pretty durable but only time can tell. the olive black color is darker and slightly browner than pictured, a nice shade that will fade gracefully. the jacket is perfect and i hope it lasts a while.

column4: dickies men's big-tall sanded sherpa lined hooded jacket
column6: very good

column4: dickies men's big-tall sanded sherpa lined hooded jacket

column4: dickies men's big-tall sanded sherpa lined hooded jacket
column6: it is a decent jacket for now, but after a week of using it, the jacket has a tear. the tear is on the seam with the hood.  i noticed it on the second week after buying it. the tear is by the seam between the hood and the rest of the jacket. it's disappointing, but thankfully the jacket keeps me warm.

column4: dickies men's big-tall sanded sherpa lined hooded jacket
column6: this coat was bought as a work coat to withstand frigid temperatures. it was first bought in an 3 xl reg and it was too big then it was bought in an 2 xlb and this one is pretty fitted with a t-shirt and hoodie. the coat was worn in -11 degrees and heavy winds and it stood up very well! the hood is over sized but not problematic. all and all a good purchase. he loves it!

column6: nice jacket. famous dicky quality. i'm 6'  170 lbs. with long arms . and 32 waist. i bought large tall. fits a hair big on arms. the elastic wrists fit snug keeps sleeves from sliding over hands. 32 waist fits good  .34 might be snug. also hangs down to crotch. draw back the hood is very big will hang down in front of your eyes. made for giant headed people.wearing a ball cap under hood helps. not sure if just a large would fit better than large tall. i am extremely happy with this coat. nice and warm also.

column6: it will keep you warm, its easy to wash.

column4: dickies men's big-tall sanded sherpa lined hooded jacket
column6: nice quality coat - very warm and appears pretty durable.  only complaint is it's pretty short wasted...wish it was 2-3 inches longer, and that applies to all sizes - i purchased a number of these in various sizes for our employees.

column4: dickies men's big-tall sanded sherpa lined hooded jacket
column6: let me start by saying i really like this jacket. it is soft and very warm, and the lining not being in the sleeves is not an issue. i think if the sherpa lining were in the sleeves, it would be hard to get on and off. i have an unlined carhartt jacket and i like this much more than my carhartt. the carhartt is so bulky and stiff it's very uncomfortable and i don't wear it much. this one, though big, is not really bulky and not stiff at all. i only gave 4 stars due to some sizing issues. i am a female and i usually wear a 2x but i ordered a 3x bc i wanted this to be loose. it is not very loose and i am glad i went up a size.  it is very tight around my hips when zipped. the sleeves however are really loose. they fall down over my hands even when snapped on the tightest snap, and i have large hands. however, it is so comfortable i don't really care about the sizing issues much. it is not flattering at all, but for a country girl hanging out at bonfires that doesn't matter to me.

column4: dickies men's big-tall sanded sherpa lined hooded jacket
column6: i ordered this just before we got hit with a long and drawn out winter season here in ky.  glad i did, the jacket has held up beautifully and kept me warm many cold days.  my only wish is that they offered this jacket in a slightly larger size.  i ordered the largest they had (5x) and it fits, but is just a bit tight.  i am a big dude and have a hard time finding clothing that fits and still has a reasonable price (i know there are tons of big and fat stores, but most things are way overpriced for us big fellas - or maybe i'm just spoiled coming from a small southern town where things are just different from where i am now).overall i am satisfied with the jacket, it's a bit small but i can fit and zip it all the way with no real trouble.  it is very warm and not too heavy.

column4: dickies men's big-tall sanded sherpa lined hooded jacket
column6: it's absolutely  perfect for snow and wind.

column4: dickies men's big-tall sanded sherpa lined hooded jacket
column6: jacket feels warm and durable. i just wish it was a little longer. if i bend over, i know i'll feel a draft going up my back.

column4: dickies men's big-tall sanded sherpa lined hooded jacket
column6: got a long for the first time because they were out of the regular fit. was a little nervous since i'm not quite 6ft tall. its not noticably long and i think the extra length will be great for say bending over and getting that nasty draft up your back. the extra sleeve length is more fabric to keep your arms warm. i would buy this again although it seems pretty tough. i do concrete so i shred cloths up pretty fast. great price for the product. also.. i think they fixed that giant hood issue because mine isn't big like the ones displayed here.

column4: dickies men's big-tall sanded sherpa lined hooded jacket
column6: great fit. i'm 6'4" tall and weigh 185 lbs. i just have an issue with the fabric wanting to stall the zipper in one spot. i have figured out that pulling outward on the zipper in that short area i can easily zip the jacket up. the hood is larger than on any other jacket i have owned, but i wear a baseball or trucker's style hat so it's not a big deal. also the hood does not have any draw strings but seems to be ok if the jacket is zipped all the way.

column4: dickies men's big-tall sanded sherpa lined hooded jacket
column6: purchased this jacket for my husband who works outside throughout the winter cutting wood and clearing brush.  i was looking for a field-type jacket that was like a carhartt, but less stiff and more wearable.  this was it.  the fit was on the money, the length was good, and there are many pockets (which my husband loves).

column4: dickies men's big-tall sanded sherpa lined hooded jacket
column6: absolutely more than expected! definitely quality for the money!we bought 2!my husband and i use as our heaviest coat fir camping and other activities!i love it on him so i when 1 st order was too small for him . i fell in love with it so instead of a return we spent another $150 .best coat investment!!

column4: dickies men's big-tall sanded sherpa lined hooded jacket
column6: i first purchased a standard large b/c i feared the large tall would be too long.  after receipt the sleeves of the standard large were too short so i immediately returned it and ordered a large tall.  the torso length of the large tall is good but the sleeves are still too short as they leave my wrists and slightly above exposed when driving a vehicle, etc.  i'm 6'0" tall, 190 lbs, 32" waste.  my other jackets are standard large and do not have this same sleeve length issue.  also the jacket i received has a bizzare odor that i cannot get rid of.  right out of the box it smelled and that eve i hung it in our coat closet and now several other coats have that same smell.  i've washed this coat twice, treated with fabreeze which helps mask the foul odor.  but after the fabreeze dissapates it smells bad again.  it hangs in my cube at work and makes my cube area smell, and co-workers complain.  on one hand it's a very warm, comfortable jacket, with decent workmanship.  but the sleeve length and foul odor make it a big dissapointment.  so unless you're built like a penguin i recommend buying local so you can try it on and make sure it does not stink.

column4: dickies men's big-tall sanded sherpa lined hooded jacket
column6: overall i like this jacket, it is very warm. i wouldn't hesitate to wear this to shovel snow from my driveway, but it's not exactly a mountaineering jacket either. it will stop some wind and rain, but not much. this is the 3rd one i've bought, and the only reason i've replaced them is because i spend so much time outside that the black coat will turn an odd red/grey, so obviously not the most uv resistant dye. on my second coat, the left inside pocket stitching came apart, so i used some fabric glue to reattach it. on my newest one,  the arms are a little short on me, and the zipper sticks about 2/3 of the way down.

column4: dickies men's big-tall sanded sherpa lined hooded jacket
column6: i just got this few days ago and tried it on yesterday for the first time (i ordered the long model after reading the other reviews)the size of the jacket is great, its slightly bigger (not taller) than expected, but thats not bad actually in case someone wears anything beneath it.however, the hood is comically over sized, in the photo i just simply pulled it over my head with simple motion with no adjustments what so ever, i can pretty much only see the ground couple of meters ahead of me.

column4: dickies men's big-tall sanded sherpa lined hooded jacket
column6: my husband wears his midweight jacket underneath, so he can take this jacket off at work, and leave the other on. he works in a dealership garage so it’s not always the warmest. he likes the the way the wrist has the band inside the outer sleeve, so you don’t get a draft up the arm.

column4: dickies men's big-tall sanded sherpa lined hooded jacket
column6: well made jacket . hood resembles a monks cowl , hence the 4 stars . i was able to sew a 3 inch pleat across the shaping seams and tack it down where the hood meets the jacket . as with other dickies jackets there is no hanging loop , something else i had to rectify . all in all though , my husband loves the jacket .

column4: dickies men's big-tall sanded sherpa lined hooded jacket
column6: nice over sleeves but a bit short over the front (large dude). material, zipper, and weight is perfect. the hood is blizzard ready as it reaches over and hangs half way down the face line. for my size a 4xlt would fit better, but this one gets the job done with a few layers to take care of the belt line gap.

column4: dickies men's big-tall sanded sherpa lined hooded jacket
column6: the coat is really warm and fits me perfectly. my only complaint is the hood seems entirely too large. it falls down over my eyes. probably won't be so bad when i start wearing my wool hat. until then, i probably won't use it unless i have to.i don't think you'll find a warmer or better quality coat for the price i paid ($49.99). i would recommend this coat to anyone.

column4: dickies men's big-tall sanded sherpa lined hooded jacket
column6: jacket length is a little short

column4: dickies men's big-tall sanded sherpa lined hooded jacket
column6: 5'7" 330lbs fits absolutelyperfectly. i got the 3xl tall because i didn't want to run a risk of the jacket being too short. perfect length and great fit overall. 5 out of 5.

column4: dickies men's big-tall sanded sherpa lined hooded jacket
column6: i was planning on buying a carhartt coat, as i buy from them a lot, but they didn't have a style in my size that i liked. so i took a chance with this coat, and man, it is awesome. it's warm. it's comfortable. it's got a ton of pockets (which i love). it is a little baggy or puffy, so when i had to wear a backpack or harness with it, it took a little adjusting, but overall, this coat is incredible.

column4: dickies men's big-tall sanded sherpa lined hooded jacket
column6: i got the 2xlt green version of this dickies big tall sherpa lined hooded eisenhower jacket and its pretty much perfect. i modified it cutting the elastic out of the inner sleeve cuff and that made me a lot happier. its a little heavier than it is warm, but thats prefect for texas. i sort need to breathe it out in the middle of the day.

column4: dickies men's big-tall sanded sherpa lined hooded jacket
column6: this jacket is very well made. it is heavy, durable and very warm. i live in central ontario and we are no stranger to -13f winter temps. the sherpa lining (chest, back and hood) is very insulating and comfortable. the sleeves are heavily quilted and also very warm. i like the dual layered cuffs, keeps wind and wet out and the covers my leather gloves perfectly. hood is a little on the large size, but manageable. i would definitely buy another of these jackets, but i have a feeling it's going to last awhile!

column4: dickies men's big-tall sanded sherpa lined hooded jacket
column6: i bought this for my 18 year old stepson an he loves it...the sizing was true too form and the jacket is of the high quality we know dickies brand for...it arrived yesterday, just in time for my stepson to wear it while christmas caroling outside with his madrigal choir group...we live in minnesota and the temperature was frigid...he came home all smiles telling us how warm and toasty the jacket kept him....it was a great night seeing his smile of delight...thanks dickies!!!

column4: dickies men's big-tall sanded sherpa lined hooded jacket
column6: great jacket. the fit is as expected. i am 6'5" 300 lbs and the jacket is a good fit except for the hood. i can fit it over my motor cycle helmet. i am not sure why it is so large but that does not take away from this being a great jacket for an extra tall 3 extra large guy. thanks dickies for nice work clothing.

column4: wrangler men's regular blanket lined denim jacket
column6: the purchase of this jacket was one of my best-researched, but still worrying purchases. as it's not available from wrangler au i had to order in from wrangler us. there are many lined denim or corduroy jackets about, but sizing varies considerably amongst the various brands. i currently own no wrangler jackets to compare the new one with, and having two choices in xl (46 & 48) was slightly confusing, but welcome. my main worry was whether i needed 46 (slightly larger than my nominal chest size) or 48 to allow for layering. i ordered 46 and it was an extremely anxious (and rather long) wait for it to arrive. it fits well, the 48 would have been too big. having recently bought an unlined jacket in xxl from a different company, which was too small for anything but summer shirts underneath, i was very relieved.i noted comments in reviews about the buttons and concur with those complaints- the button holes are indeed poorly executed  and very tight when new. one of the sizing issues i had was whether my arms would feel constricted with the lining. many lined jackets do not extend the lining to the arms. even with winter clothes on i could get my arms in fine with this jacket, and allowance in sizing appears to have been made for the blanket lining. i noted comments about plain grey blanket lining but mine is the red/grey mix as per product photos.the price was reasonable and compared favourably with wrangler jackets available in australia. indeed, amazon's price was a little better than wrangler's own when usd was converted to aud, with free shipping. my only minor complaint with this jacket would be that it looks a little too "western" for this urban cowboy, but it is after all a wrangler.the jacket looks great with the corduroy collar, preferable to either plain denim or fake sheepskin, and the blanket lining is more attractive than other wrangler jackets which have bright red plaid flannel or the aforementioned "sherpa", or fake sheepskin. overall i'm very pleased with this jacket, and can add to my collection of countries of manufacture for later "us" goods, for this jacket was made in nicaragua. it certainly beats "made in china".

column4: wrangler men's regular blanket lined denim jacket
column6: está hecha con mezclilla, forro y botones de excelente calidad.no destiñe al lavar y secar en máquina.es muy caliente porque tiene un forro de paño de lana, no aborregado.luce bastante bien y es la clásica chamarra vaquera de estilo muy varonil.

column4: wrangler men's regular blanket lined denim jacket
column6: after reading reviews i got a size larger than i normally wear. it fits pretty loose in the body but the arms are just right. good solid work/casual coat. i recommend it to anyone

column4: wrangler men's regular blanket lined denim jacket
column6: great quality. best price i've ever seen. looks and feels great. fully lined as expected but its light weight and warm. my teen daughters gave me the thumbs up!  i do recommend it.however, i ordered size 44 based on the size chart. i should have guessed that i would receive a 44l from a tall and big listing.  i thought about returning it but it fits well in the body and feels quite comfortable on. it actually works out better because the long extends below the belt and below the wrists which keeps out the cold.

column4: wrangler men's regular blanket lined denim jacket
column6: regular delivery option was fast.  excellent quality of materials and workmanship. looks great and warm enough for canadian winters.  in my opinion only improvement would be one or two inside large pockets.  i'm a short stocky guy, about 5 ft 3in and 160lbs, jacket fits very good but with most jackets i just need to fold in the sleeves a little for an excellent fit.  this jacket is hard to find in stores but when available it is usually at least 50% more in price.

column4: wrangler men's regular blanket lined denim jacket
column6: arrived as described.  i am 6'3", 250 lbs, medium build.  initial fit is very good.  the jacket arms cuff reaches past my wrist to mid thumb area. the jackets length is long enough and is about 5" below my belt line (mid hip)  there is sufficient room when buttoned making wearing of a hoody underneath comfortable without being restricted or too tight.happy with my purchase.

column4: wrangler men's regular blanket lined denim jacket
column6: i had no issues with buttons or anything as some other reviews stated. true to size. the quality is excellent, and it is incredibly warm!  i could not be happier,and it looks great!

column4: wrangler men's regular blanket lined denim jacket
column6: true to size, very well made and has kept me warm in 18 degree f weather.

column4: wrangler men's regular blanket lined denim jacket

column4: wrangler men's regular blanket lined denim jacket
column6: i’m 5’10 and bought a 40. it fits exactly right. i weigh 165lbs. i could’ve even sized up to a 42. the jacket fits true to size and the sleeves and body are shorter than usual. similar to a levi jacket than my other flannel lined wrangler in a medium which fits larger than this. the jacket is decent quality besides the entire lining and sleeves being synthetic. the cotton shell is good. i dislike the button holes and hem because the stitching is loose all around and the button holes have lots of excess thread or aren’t cut open wide enough. so you have to burn off the excess and cut some holes a bit wider. overall it’s alright. but it should be higher quality for the price. the flannel lined wrangler has none of these defects and is cheaper but not as warm. this collar is nice too and once it’s broken in i’m sure it’ll be great. wrangler in 2020. still alright. if you can find a lightly used vintage i suggest that route instead.

column4: wrangler men's regular blanket lined denim jacket

column4: wrangler men's regular blanket lined denim jacket
column6: jacket fits great. the sleeves are perfect,not too long, not too short. the chest is a little loose but acceptable. nice heavy denim. this jacket has the true blanket lining. wrangler sells another jacket with a "blanket lining" that to me is just thin flannel. the only thing i really don't care for is the collar, which is a tan corduroy type material. i would have preferred just regular blue denim. people have complained that the buttons are too stiff and they had to snip the threads in the button holes. the buttons are stiff,  but after using for a week they are starting to loosen on their own. the jacket is warm for 30+degree temperatures. anything colder may need a heavier coat. all in all i believe this jacket is well worth the price

column4: wrangler men's regular blanket lined denim jacket
column6: he has had other denim jackets but not one with lining.  he says that makes all the difference.  loves it.

column4: wrangler men's regular blanket lined denim jacket
column6: i bought 2 lined wrangler jackets at the same time, for different people. both looked great. this one had a really coarse, rough feel to the lining. it's described as a blanket lining, & was a lot thicker/heavier than the other jacket, which has a flannel lining. it may soften upon washing, but i was leery to chance it. nothing cozy about the fabric at all. returned.

column4: wrangler men's regular blanket lined denim jacket
column6: the blanket sort of feels like a mixture of glue and toothbrush bristles. it’s almost a solid mass. i imagine after 8-10 washes it might be passable but i don’t see it ever being very soft. returned in favor of the flannel lined jacket. love the color of the denim though, but the light khaki colored collar really killed it for me. just doesn’t look good.

column4: wrangler men's regular blanket lined denim jacket
column6: just what i was looking for.

column4: wrangler men's regular blanket lined denim jacket
column6: i've worn levi's forever.  no longer interested in their newer styles and advertising.  so, trying wrangler.  their denim jacket is well made other than the buttonholes are too small making it fairly hard to button and unbutton, but i rarely do so anyway.  the color is darker than i expected.  i was actually looking for a more worn look.  but it's not bad.  all in all, a good jacket.

column4: wrangler men's regular blanket lined denim jacket
column6: this was a gift and the person reported that it fit perfectly so i guess they are good with it

column4: wrangler men's regular blanket lined denim jacket
column6: i wanted real denim and got it.  the overall weight was heavier than expected, especially for eastern north carolina.  i like the corduroy collar because it gives color contrast.  there was a slight stitching issue near one of the lower pockets but hardly noticeable. my wife says it looks good on me.

column4: wrangler men's regular blanket lined denim jacket
column6: large fits me well with a light hoodie underneath. 5' 8" 170 and normally wear 42-44 jacket. button holes were proper size and no flaws were found after washing. sleeve cuffs and chest pockets use metal snaps not buttons and they are much easier to use. color is definitely new denim blue. i'm sure it will "age" a bit with a few washings though. overall i'm very pleased and much warmer in my open topped jeep in the cold early mornings.  mine says made in nicaragua.

column4: wrangler men's regular blanket lined denim jacket
column6: very good jacket for the price. it’s exactly what i expected and wanted.

column4: wrangler men's regular blanket lined denim jacket
column6: this jacket is so warm it fits great im 6’1 at 190 and i got a large and its perfect…i highly recommend it…

column4: wrangler men's regular blanket lined denim jacket
column6: great jacket overall. been keeping me warm. only complaint would be that it doesn’t have any inside pockets. first size i bought was too large but got a smaller size and gifted the first one to my brother. he loves it as well.

column4: wrangler men's regular blanket lined denim jacket
column6: i’ve always wanted a blue jean jacket and i had to wait till i was 66 to get one. this is one well-made wrangler blue jean jacket. i am very pleased. if i could give it 10 stars i would i would tell anybody that is looking for one to buy this one because it’s gonna be gone soon since wrangler discontinued it which i can’t understand well-built, and worth what i paid for

column4: wrangler men's regular blanket lined denim jacket
column6: had to replace my husbands old denim jacket that he had for so many years.  this is a different brand than then the other one, but looks like it.  this jacket is made very well except for the fact that when we went to unbutton to try it on we had a very had time getting the buttons undone.  once we did i had to clip some of the threads to make it easier for next time.  on the top pockets you can see a faint line right aross, but only notice if you are looking for it.  does not really take away from the jacket.  husband is very pleased and we would definitely purchase another one in the future.

column4: wrangler men's regular blanket lined denim jacket
column6: i like the quality of the jacket. well made, the lining is warm. the button closure is reinforced with multiple stitch passing. great cowboy jacket from wrangler and the look is spot on. get one if you can.

column4: wrangler men's regular blanket lined denim jacket
column6: this is a great denim jacket.  i’ve loved my unlined wrangler denim jacket for the past twenty five years, and still wear it.  but i decided i wanted to have a warmer version for cold nights or days.  i ordered this jacket and i was really happy with the blanket lining.  it’s a nice thick lining.  it’s not too bulky, but really adds warmth.  the weight of the denim jacket is nice and thick and cuts the wind pretty well.  on top of that, wrangler denim fades really nicely over time, only getting better with age.  i really like this jacket a lot.  the lighter colored corduroy color is okay.  i would have preferred the classic blue denim collar, but the light corduroy looks a little sharper for wearing out to dinner, if that makes a difference to you.

column4: men's arctic quilted lined duck vest washed full zip up utility rugged canvas work vest jacket
column6: husband loves it,fits great.very warm.husband loves it fits great very warm.would recommend

column4: men's arctic quilted lined duck vest washed full zip up utility rugged canvas work vest jacket
column6: i purchased it for my boyfriend to replace a well broken in carhartt vest. right away you can tell it’s great quality. i was worried at first it might have been too large, and even my boyfriend has said it was too big. until you wash it. after that i had him try it on again without telling him i washed it and he said hey you made it fit. i also did put it up back to back to another vest he wears all the time and it aaa spot on same size. i’ve got a bad habit of shrinking things in the dryer from time to time, so i made sure i  did dry it on low, zipped up and inside out in an effort to keep the zipper straight and from ugly folds getting worked in from being rolled in the dryer, other wise i normally wouldn’t put it in the dryer.prolonged high heat can wear the elastic and metal out faster . a feature that is different than the big name brand is the collar, instead of a turn down type it’s more of an elastic ribbing. that can be nice if it you get to wearing a shirt with a collar or flannel,  there’s less bulk in the chin area, which i think enables more maneuverability without those items interfering doing some physical out door activities. the only thing it didn’t have that a big name brand did was another additional inner pocket and the outer zipper chest pocket. but i think that’s first world problems. my boyfriend is 5’11 and 200 pounds  wears large size size shirts and large size jackets and vests.i ordered what he wears. he’s been wearing it since he got it. it’s looks kinda fluffy until it’s broken in if you know what i mean.

column4: men's arctic quilted lined duck vest washed full zip up utility rugged canvas work vest jacket
column6: i wanted a vest that is warm and rugged. this meets both.

column4: men's arctic quilted lined duck vest washed full zip up utility rugged canvas work vest jacket
column6: i like this vest.  very comfortable for working in climates like here on the oregon coast, not too cold.  i did a big fence project yesterday; up and down, rolling around in the dirt, laying on the ground.  the canvas material brushed right off without a stain.  it fits a tad bigger than i had hoped.  maybe one washing will bring it down a tad;  the insulation is quite warm and feels nice, doesn't bind up.  certainly good value for the price point.  the competitive industry standard leader is 3x this cost.  good deal.

column4: men's arctic quilted lined duck vest washed full zip up utility rugged canvas work vest jacket
column6: i was looking for a work “duck cotton” type vest. was looking for something that wasn’t as stiff and expensive as carhartt, or to thin as a walmart wrangler(no hood vest-the hooded vest is actually a great compromise but didn’t want a hood).  this vest fit the bill. feels thick but not stiff. very comfortable. seems to run a little big(as i tried on large vest in all the varieties i tried on) and this one felt bigger. so i ordered a size down, and now i’m really happy with the fit. i’m 5’9 190lbs. highly recommend this vest for the price!

column4: men's arctic quilted lined duck vest washed full zip up utility rugged canvas work vest jacket
column6: warm and appears durable.

column4: men's arctic quilted lined duck vest washed full zip up utility rugged canvas work vest jacket
column6: we usually have mild winters in puget sound region of western washington, but every so often it actually gets too cold for my usual fleece vest to keep me warm. when the temperature dropped into the low 20s last month, it was the perfect opportunity to see how effective this quilt-lined canvas duck vest would be for some hiking around town. my only concern was that it might be too warm...but the vest kept me comfortable without overheating.the canvas exterior is rugged and a bit stiff, though it should break in with more wear.  it fits me very well, especially around the shoulders and armholes. the ribbed collar is soft enough not to irritate my neck. i haven't worn the vest outside while it's drizzling or snowing, so i can't comment on how well it resists moisture.only negative is that this vest makes me look even chunkier than i am, leading my spousal unit to claim i resemble a toasted sta-puft marshmallow man. which made me crave marshmallows, and we all know that won't help.

column4: men's arctic quilted lined duck vest washed full zip up utility rugged canvas work vest jacket
column6: this is a big and comfortable vest. the canvas outer portion is tough as nails and will probably last a lifetime. there are two deep and roomy pockets too - deep enough for a smartphone (i keep my kindle in one!) there are no snaps or fasteners, so they are open pockets though. there is an internal pocket too which a bit smaller than the outer ones, but still useful.  curiously, the inner pocket has a button closure - just a bit odd in my estimation.the quilted fleece lining is plush and very warm. the vest is a great core insulator and useful both as a standalone cover on cool hikes, or a layered vest under a coat on very cold ones. i should note that although this is described as a men's vest, the zipper is on the left side.  i don't mind when zipping up, but when i unzip my right hand dominance kicks in.otherwise, this vest is terrific.

column4: men's arctic quilted lined duck vest washed full zip up utility rugged canvas work vest jacket
column6: this vest fits my husband as expected. however, apparently a pretty big deal to him is the zipper which is on the "female side".he finds it really frustrating.the inside lining is very soft, and that lining is in the hand pockets also.the material feels very much like his carhartt coats.this vest’s inside pocket has a button while carhartt's vest like this doesn't have a button on the inside pocket.it's a pretty bulky vest compared to the other one he owns and therefore warmer, but more restrictive of his movements.he likes that the collar doesn't have a flap and is very comfortable.overall, he would prefer the inside to be less soft and the zipper to start from the other side.**if you found this review helpful, please click the ‘helpful’ button below.

column4: men's arctic quilted lined duck vest washed full zip up utility rugged canvas work vest jacket
column6: the vest is waaaay better than i expected!first, i did not realize the inside of the vest is velvety quilt-lined!  so are the huge pockets!the opening to the pockets is big, and the pocket itself is huge!  plus, inside the vest, there is a big, securable hidden pocket!the neck is this cottony material that stretches but is very comfortable!  it is virtually the perfect size!i got the xxl and it has just enough room to be roomy, but it doesn't appear to be too big.  i like extra room rather than a tiny bit too tight.i compared this to big-name brands of which, i have two, and i actually like this one better!  my son has a bunch of these work vests and now he wants to still mine!  i must say, i really like this vest!  the stitching is very sturdy but unobtrusive.the fact that this vest is so comfortable, warm, and rugged is really value-added given the very reasonable price and the great looks!  if you had a business, and you needed to buy a bunch of vests and have them embroidered with your company logo while saving a bunch of money!

column4: men's arctic quilted lined duck vest washed full zip up utility rugged canvas work vest jacket
column6: this vest has a warm quilted lining and the outer material is a medium weight duck cloth. it is similar to a carhartt vest but not as stiff probably due to the stonewashed material. it doesn't have a wind flap behind the zipper and the zipper pulls from the left side which may be a little awkward for some people. overall it appears to be well made and should be a fine work vest.

column4: men's arctic quilted lined duck vest washed full zip up utility rugged canvas work vest jacket
column6: man, this is a fantastic vest. outer material is 100% cotton canvas,12-ounce washed duck cloth- which is not water repellent, but it can be treated.  however it is very tough.the nylon lining  insulation is super warm and fuzzy, and even in the pockets, so your hands feel warm and fuzzy too!  the lining sets this vest aside- not just warm but comfortable too!not necessarily a work  vest , good for daily use during the cooler times of year.sadly, i wont get to wear it much, my wife appropriated it!overall, this "zenthace men's washed arctic-quilt lined duck vest utility rugged canvas work vest" was a big hit!

column4: men's arctic quilted lined duck vest washed full zip up utility rugged canvas work vest jacket
column6: the interior of this vest is super soft and comfortable. it's a thicker vest that the last few i have purchased, and will be much warmer in colder weather. when i received this it was super wrinkly from the packaging to the point where i has to wash and iron it. runs a tad big.

column4: men's arctic quilted lined duck vest washed full zip up utility rugged canvas work vest jacket
column6: even though this is a men's vest i got it for myself. this jacket has a wonderful soft felt like liner in it. it's very warm. the vest as a whole is very rugged yet stylish. it's great for horseback riding or working outdoors with animals. i will definitely keep this for a long time.

column4: men's arctic quilted lined duck vest washed full zip up utility rugged canvas work vest jacket
column6: my dad loves this vest.  it's so similar to car <3 brand, you can barely tell the difference between the 2 when compared side by side.but, if you look at your wallet, you'll def be able to tell the difference being as that this vest costs almost less than half of what the brand name version does.we applied additional scotch-guard but because my dad wears it on a regular basis, it still needed to be washed after a month of use.  it washed up perfectly.  no fade, no shrinkage whatsoever.  we hung it on a hanger to dry, not in the dryer.our entire family has always been big carhartt fans, and continue to be, but this vest is a solid choice as well .i hope you like it as much as my dad does.  :)thank you for reading.

column4: men's arctic quilted lined duck vest washed full zip up utility rugged canvas work vest jacket
column6: made of heavy-duty canvas, this is a very sturdy, warm  vest to wear while doing any heavy job - hunting, or doing farm work.  it has a very heavy zipper and a knit edging around the neckline and the interior is lined with black fleece - as are the pockets.  it has two interior pockets which come in handy.  great workmanship - very impressive vest!

column4: men's arctic quilted lined duck vest washed full zip up utility rugged canvas work vest jacket
column6: this vest completely blocks the wind. the hand pockets are lined with sort of a crushed velvet material; super warm. the zipper is tough and made of metal, not plastic. the inner pocket is fully enclosed with a button so nothing will fall out. all the stitching and workmanship is good on it. even with just a t-shirt underneath, it keeps me warm in 40º to 50º temperatures. if it's windy, i'll throw on an outer jacket with it. i'm wearing a size xl in the photos.

column4: men's arctic quilted lined duck vest washed full zip up utility rugged canvas work vest jacket
column6: this is a warm and comfortable jacket, light weight and true to size.the inside lining and pockets is made of an almost velour like material.  it's very soft and warm.my son wears and xx-large in his shirts and coats and this xx-large is a perfect fit.the jacket zips from the left and works flawlessly.we've purchased many sleeveless jackets in the past and this one is definitely one of the best we've owned.very good value.

column4: men's arctic quilted lined duck vest washed full zip up utility rugged canvas work vest jacket
column6: the vest is sized correctly ,it is extremely warm,and feels extremely durable ,you do not have to worry about it snagging and ripping easily at work. it is lined with a velvet material that is very soft. it has 2 internal pockets large enough for a cell phone or pack of cigarettes. i have received many compliments while wearing it so far.

column4: men's arctic quilted lined duck vest washed full zip up utility rugged canvas work vest jacket
column6: i am a big guy and it's sometimes difficult to find clothes that fit well.  not the case with this vest.  it's roomy and warm.  there is plenty of room to maneuver.it's heavy duty, stiched well and will withstand the rigors of work.it's easy to give this quality vest a positive review.

column6: es lo que se ve, ni más ni menos. no tiene forro polar por dentro ni nada, es solo del material que se ve y es muy cómodo y práctico, no pesa nada y se puede hacer muy pequeño para guardarlo en bolsos y maletas. a mi me encanta.

column4: charles river apparel men's pack-n-go windbreaker pullover

column4: charles river apparel men's pack-n-go windbreaker pullover
column6: i bought this three years ago and it's still a great summer windbreaker. no rips or holes after 3 years. i only wear it when it's rainy or windy. it packs up small and is waterproof.  you should buy it

column4: charles river apparel men's pack-n-go windbreaker pullover
column6: pedí este producto de manera anticipada, aún no empezaban las lluvias, apenas había llovido pocas veces por lo cual no había sido posible poner a prueba el producto. sin embargo hoy, con una lluvia moderada pero constante, demostró su efectividad. en mi traslado a pie de mi casa a la oficina, aproximadamente 10 minutos. llegué completamente seco (al menos del torso, que es la parte que cubre) en realidad parece mágico, las gotas de agua resbalan, no penetran la fibra. el producto es 100% ligero, fácil de guardar/transportar. en cuestion a la talla, generalmente soy talla mediana, sin embargo estuve leyendo las opiniones de otros compradores y con base a ello pedí una talla mas chica, entonces pedí talla chica aun siendo mediano y para mi sorpresa (positiva) me queda a la perfección. así que efectivamente pidan una talla mas chica de preferencia, por otro lado cabe mencionar que esta talla a pesar de ser mas chica de lo que normalmente acostumbro y de que me quedó bastante bien, estoy seguro de que me da todavía la oportunidad de usar alguna chamarra por debajo, en caso de ser necesario, aunque es importante mencionar, que la prenda no permite que salga el calor de tu propio cuerpo, por lo cual, a pesar de ser tan delgada, no sientes frío, pero no se debe meramente a que sea una prenda caliente, sino que se encierra tu propio calor, mientras que te lo pongas cuando aún estás seco, cumplirá su función a la perfección. otros momentos en los que he tenido la oportunidad de probarlo han sido en carretera en moto y tambien se ha desempeñado de manera cabal.

column6: this is the 2nd jacket i ordered (different color). i really like them... i am a hoodie person and love that this is just like having a hoodie on. love that it has a zippered pocket and when i need to i can fold it all into a pouch. definately will order another color. it is a bit big for me but that is what i ordered as i wanted to be able to put on a hoodie on cooler days/nights.

column4: charles river apparel men's pack-n-go windbreaker pullover
column6: this is the windbreaker i grab when i'm heading to an outdoor event with a small possibility of some rain. it's lightweight, packs up reasonably well, and has a roomy fit. it's not plastic like a real raincoat, and i wouldn't expect it to keep me dry in a downpour; it's just a layer between you and the damp of a windy drizzle.i prefer this men's fit because it's easy to pull on and off without yanking up all the clothes i have on underneath. i like the material, which is more like a normal fabric than your typical rain gear. the hood is roomy enough to hold all my hair, loose or in a ponytail. the one thing i don't like is the amount of “noise” this windbreaker makes: any movement, large or small, generates a loud swish-swish-swish sound! people definitely will hear you coming long before you arrive!

column4: charles river apparel men's pack-n-go windbreaker pullover
column6: bit tight but that's maybe because i'm a fat get  still wearing it tho

column4: charles river apparel men's pack-n-go windbreaker pullover
column6: not bad

column4: charles river apparel men's pack-n-go windbreaker pullover
column6: this windbreaker fits well.  i've worn it in light rain a couple of times and it has done a good job of keeping me dry.  it's light weight and easy to pack.  my only quibble is the label flap on the back of the neck.  for reason i understand, they didn't want to sew the label onto the inside of the back panel of the windbreaker.  it would have created an unsightly seam conforming to the label on the outside of the back panel.  this could also have been another seam that allows water infiltration.  however, their solution was to sew an extra fabric panel on the inside that shares the seam between the hood and the back panel.  onto this they sewed all the labels.  it actually looks very nice.  however, when you pull this over your head, this flap, only secured on the top seam, often flips up outside of the neckline.  it's easily tucked back in.  but, it's a minor nuisance and something that could have easily been solved by printing the label onto the inside of the back panel fabric rather than using a separate label that requires sewing.  if not for this, i would give it five stars.  it's a very good product for the money, just not an excellent one due to a design decision.

column4: charles river apparel men's pack-n-go windbreaker pullover
column6: i purchased this jacket because i love hoodies and with the warmer weather coming it will be to hot with a hoodie on. i absolutely love it. the material is lovey it is softish and i get many compliments on it and everyone asks where i bought it from. i have sent many of my friends your way to purchase them as well. i will be ordering in a different color soon.there is one thing for me, i have short arms and the arms are too long, but i just fold them under and that works just fine as the cuffs have and elasitc band inside.the rest fits just wonderful, lots of room if it was a chilly night and i wanted to wear a hoodie under it,

column4: charles river apparel men's pack-n-go windbreaker pullover

column4: carhartt men's gilliam vest
column6: i was wanting something that wasn’t  bulky and comber some, which this jacket is neither.  it’s dressy enough for just about anything and perfect with just a pair of jeans and a nice shirt.  warm enough to work in cooler temperatures, but not in super cold, 30 and below...but what is?  the extra inside pockets are perfect.  at first i didn’t think i would like the reverse flap front “hand” pockets, but they are actually very good and come with a single snap. things don’t fall out of the front pockets like money and keys when you sit down and if you were concerned about someone pick pocketing you, they would definitely have a more difficult time.  great vest and i would definitely buy it again.

column4: carhartt men's gilliam vest
column6: love this vest good quality. i should have got l tall, but thats my fault. anyone else 6 foot 1 185lbs make sure you get xl or l tall.

column4: carhartt men's gilliam vest
column6: poor build quality and customer service policy.  i just got this vest and after the first wash (per the tags washing instructions) a seem is torn.  i called carhart customer service.  they are having me send mine back so they can inspect it and determine if it is a defect or not.  if they determine it is a defect, then they will send me a new one.  this whole process is expected to take 2-3 weeks.  this really surprises me for carhart and the price paid for the product.  i would have expected that they would send me a new one, then i send mine back.  not happy that i will be without this for a few weeks.

column4: carhartt men's gilliam vest

column4: columbia men's cathedral peak
column6: the columbia vest - as well as the mountain full zip - are very nice and comfortable products - which most of the reviews agree with - however, i'm writing this review to talk about sizing - as few reviews actually deal with this very important aspect of any online purchase.  so i wish more people would post their height and weight and what size worked well for them.  with the vest and the mountain full zip i actually ended up purchasing a medium in both styles - even though i normally wear a large in just about everything else.  for the record, i'm six feet tall and weigh 182 pounds - and the mediums fit perfectly.

column6: hi all.  you can not go wrong with this "fleece vest", for the price.  it is very soft, and is very warm.  and it does what it claims to do.  i will be buying some more of these.  as most of the time i hate to wear bulky jackets or very heavy winter shirts.  i only need to keep my chest warmer on cold days.  for the price, this item is very well made.  it has nice deep inside pockets, and nice deep side pockets also, and the zippers are really good also.  from  dan & austin, (my yorkie)  we are full-timers, and true "spirits of the wind"

column6: this vest is as soft as a baby blanket and as light as a feather. it is more of what i would call a "slim fit", which surprised me actually. although, i was hoping for exactly that. i have always had trouble in the past ordering things that are supposed to be fitted yet turn out to be bloated. this was not the case with the cathedral peak ii vest. for the price point, i would say that you cannot afford to pass this up. the only downside is, it is made in china.

column4: columbia men's cathedral peak
column6: i am a big fan of vests in the winter--wear them daily.  i have only used ll bean and lands end in the past for vest needs.  i could not pass up the great price for this vest, though, and i was certainly not disappointed!  it's a great vest, though somewhat thinner and lighter than the other brands.  it is snugger in fit and the fleece has a nice nap to it.  i am well pleased with this vest.

column4: columbia men's cathedral peak
column6: i bought this vest as a "spare" to keep at the office. here in southern california, spring and autumn days can feel deceptively warm, only to cool down quickly to 60 f or below after dark. i have a habit of forgetting to bring any outerwear with me to the office, except in winter, and then wishing i had something light to wear for warmth if going straight from the office to a meeting or dinner or other social engagement. in this climate, a fleece vest passes for "outerwear" for all but the three coldest months. i have an older element red vest from columbia, received as a gift many years ago, which has stood the test of time, so i thought i'd order columbia again.cost is reasonable for quality and priced perhaps 20-25% less than the famous outfitter from freeport, maine charges for its equivalent product. fabric is soft and comfortable, not scratchy. detailing is nice with two zip pockets, a collar that may be worn flat or straight up, and a hanger loop---a feature that my old columbia vest lacks. fit tends to be a half size larger than usual, so that my large feels halfway between l and xl. if you want a trim fit, consider one size smaller than you usually order. on the other hand, if you want to layer it over a thermal top or sweater, buy your usual size and you'll appreciate the fuller than usual cut. another plus is that it's offered in a dozen different colors, which again presents more choices than the competitor from freeport.
