column6: just what i needed. it's a nice light shell that has excellent waterproofing. easy to bring in a backpack if you're not sure if it's gonna rain. i haven't had any issues with the waterproofing and i stood at the bottom of a large waterfall and god sprayed for a solid 15 minutes and didn't feel any soak.

column4: the north face men's m resolve 2 jacket
column6: good fit, as expected.  color is "fiery red" and it is a pretty vivid red, good for visibility in the dark, is true to that shown in the color options.  cuffs are decently elasticized to limit wind and water entry.  only two pockets, external and zippered, sufficiently sized.  i wish there had been an internal pocket.  jacket features a main zipper all the way up to the full collar with four long, intermittent strips of hook and loop on the flap to limit water and wind reaching the zipper.  the collar has a thin felt layer for comfort against the neck and chin.  the non-removable hood is plenty deep, yet not overly so and does not obstruct level vision, and folds to store in the collar.  the jacket has an interior mesh lining to assist ventilation.  the hood and and waistline have drawstrings for sizing and limiting wind and rain entry.  the north face logo is of the same color as the jacket, so is not very noticeable.  some people might prefer it to be of a contrasting color, but that might require a different material that might create opportunities for water leakage.  the seams are tape-sealed.  overall workmanship appears to be good.  i had purchased two other name-brand rain jackets but returned them for issues like excessive hood depth, excessive cuff openings and "sticky" urethane feel.  although they had features that were attractive, overall they were not as satisfactory as this the north face rain jacket.i've only tested this in light rain, so after a good, hard rain i'll hopefully enter a very positive rating on that final aspect.

column4: event leather el5315 black motorcycle leather vest for men w/side lace- riding club adult motorcycle vests - 5x-large
column6: great leather vest for the price. 4 pockets (2 outside and to big ones inside). not strong smells as other reviews on different vests than this one. as in most vests, order one size up, even though the leather laces will help to tighten the vest. i wear a size 44 jacket and i would normally would wear a l vest, but i ordered an xl and it fits perfect. arrived promptly with 2 day prime shipping in a large, flat box without being folded, great for a leather garment. the leather itself is not as soft as napa leather, but more to a stiffer texture, not too thick, not too thin, which i don't think is a problem on a biker's vest. i was also able to sew 4 patches with a household needle and black thread slowly, but without any issues, even though it was difficult being leather.  it also comes with a black satin liner and bronze snap buttons. overall, very satisfied with this purchase, especially at $29.99.

column4: event leather el5315 black motorcycle leather vest for men w/side lace- riding club adult motorcycle vests - 5x-large
column6: pleasantly surprised.  i purchased this mainly to put together a machete costume, so i didn't want to spend much money.  for $30.00 with prime shipping, it was perfect.  i ordered a large and it's true to size.  the leather quality seems good, it's not motorcycle jacket thick,  but thick and heavy enough that you won't think it'll fall apart on you.  the laces on the side are leather straps.  it has a satiny black lining and 2 large interior pockets.  looking at it, i would think it worth at least twice what i paid for it.

column4: stockerpoint ricardo men's costume vest
column6: my german husband often wears trachten (german/austrian traditional clothing), but was looking for something extra to wear over his shirt in winter.anyone who's ever bought trachten will know that it can be hugely expensive.  so this was a bit of a speculative purchase to see whether he'd enjoy wearing a traditional waistcoat.it has been a great success, in that it fits well, is comfortable and looks good.  the only criticism that i would possibly offer is that the 'velvet' material is not of a particularly high quality, but then that's to be expected for the very affordable price.now that i've had a good experience of this brand, i'd probably choose to make future purchases from their higher priced range, knowing that it would be worn often (and thus justifying a greater cost).this would also be ideal for someone looking to buy this as a novelty item for an event such as oktoberfest.

column4: stockerpoint ricardo men's costume vest
column6: die samtweste ricardo von stockerpoint hat eine gute, wenn auch geradlinig breit geschnittene passform, jedoch lässt sie sich mit dem einstellriegel hinten leicht taillieren.insgesamt wirkt sie hochwertig, ist natürlich dem preis entsprechend nicht ganz so hochwertig verarbeitet wie deutlich hochpreisigere samtwesten anderer hersteller.für das fest im kleineren kreis oder um die tracht allgemein etwas aufzuwerten ist sie allemal gut, zumal nicht so viel kaputt geht wenn sie dann doch mal verfleckt.für hochzeiten (als bräutigamm), staatsempfänge o.ä. würde ich sie nicht empfehlen. da rentiert sich meiner meinung nach die investition in ein teureres modell von diversen namhaften trachtmodenherstellern.

column4: stockerpoint ricardo men's costume vest
column6: ich hab mich für die „stockerpoint herren weste ricardo trachtenweste“ entschieden, da ich für das nächste frühlingsfest und oktoberfest  (nach corona :)) eine neue samtweste brauchte.positiv:  + schöne satte dunkelrote farbe (siehe fotos)  + knopfleiste mit matten metall kugelknöpfe – so wie ich's mir vorgestellt habe  + passt mir perfekt – sonst habe ich ebenfalls größe 50 bzw. größe m  + sehr gute verarbeitung  + 100% baumwolle. das innenfutter ist aber aus 100% polyester (siehe foto)neutral:  o  lässt sich natürlich nicht in der waschmaschine waschen – was ich mir eigentlich auch dachte. auf der  beschreibung ist aber „pflegehinweis: maschinenwäsche“ angegeben. hier muss der verkäufer aus meiner  sicht nachbessern!  o die taschenschlitze sind nur zur optik und können nicht als tasche genutzt werden. mir war das bewusst,  da es bei meiner jetzigen trachtenweste genauso ist – sollte man aber beim kauf wissen :)die dunkelrote/ bordeauxrote samtweste lässt sich sehr gut mit einem weißen hemd mit stehkragen kombinieren. ich bin hoch zufrieden und kann die „stockerpoint herren weste ricardo trachtenweste“ weiterempfehlen.ich hoffe, dass ich euch bei der entscheidungsfindung etwas helfen konnte :)

column6: columbia men fleece vest fast trek:  buono  il capo,  un  po'  meno  la  cerniera.smanicato  in  pile a  collo  alto,  da  mezza  stagione,  vestibilità  regular,  disegnato  come  capo  esterno, molto  morbido e  discreto,  utilizzabile  anche  come  gilet  da  mettere sotto il  giaccone.due  ampie  tasche  frontali e  una  napoleon sul  petto  per  lo  smartphone,  tutte  con  zip;  low  in  lavatrice  e  asciugatura  naturalemolto  scomoda  la  chiusura;  premesso  che  sono  già  abituato  alle cerniere  all'americana,  con  aggancio  sulla  sinistra,  ma  questa  è  proprio  cervellotica  e  ci  vuole  un  attimo  per  indovinare  la  manovra.buono  il  prezzo (scontato),  secondo  me  derivante  dal fatto  che  è  un  fine  serie  (infatti  mi  pare  che  sia  in  esaurimento  anche sul  sito  della  columbia).eccellente,  al  solito,  la  prime  con  domiciliazione, se  volete,  sul  locker.

column4: columbia men's fast trek fleece vest
column6: i like it. i bought the size l for a snug fit (44 inch chest) over a polo-shirt  when bike riding in the morning or evening chill. it's great for the task. flexible and snug but not too tight. the thing is i would like to buy a size xl too for other occasions but i notice the price of the xl at this review date in early june 2022 is £40.63 when all the other sizes, even the xxl, are priced around the £28 mark. there can surely be no justification for "discounting" (hmmn..) all sizes except one  ..perhaps the size that sells the most?  needless to say i won't be buying an xl unless the discrepancy disappears. otherwise though a great feeling, soft & flexible product that i recommend.

column4: red kap men's slash pocket jacket, navy, small
column6: this is the best lightweight jacket you can buy. the best at being light but keeping your warm. most automotive shops have this jacket with their logo/badge on it and their uniform color. this jacket could use an inside pocket or two, but that's not a legitimate reason to complain. this jacket is good for work and for casual wear. it resists dust and oil better than any other jacket i have tried. it also looks great when washed and washes easily in the washer. it is a polyester blend, so it does not shrink. like all clothes, i wash before wearing, and i recommend you do for this because it will soften the cotton portion of the material. it also will remove any chemical smells to make the jacket obviously smell better. i could sleep in this jacket it is that comfortable. i cannot recommend this jacket enough. if it had inside pockets, then this would be the perfect jacket. i would even wear it in the summer for my edc if it had inside pockets.

column4: red kap men's slash pocket jacket, navy, small
column6: i like the fit and feel of the jacket. i'll wear it in thorny brush and expect it will hold up well. it lacks an inside chest pocket; i valued the one in the jacket this one replaces. this one also lacks a hanging loop inside the collar. it tends to slide off the hook i hang it on. the jacket's upper arms are roomy and don't bind.update: in its first field outing, this jacket slid well through the prickly roundleaf greenbrier. it snagged some on raspberry canes and multiflora rose stems, but the shell fabric didn't tear. with all the polyester in the thread, the fabric has a more slippery hand than 100% cotton canvas would, but it resists tears and "picks" almost as well. i'm pleased with it.

column4: red kap men's slash pocket jacket, navy, small
column6: like everything, dislike nothing.  suitable for all but coldest weather.

column4: red kap men's slash pocket jacket, navy, small
column6: i like the jacket, fits well just wish it had the inside breast pocket

column4: red kap men's slash pocket jacket, navy, small
column6: love the jacket, my hubby was happy to  highly recommended for work jacket,

column4: red kap men's slash pocket jacket, navy, small
column6: i'm 5' 10", 180 lbs. and the large fits perfectly. it seems very well made but it did need washing first, as it was very stiff out of the package.no shrinkage after washing & drying, so that's good.my only gripe would be is that the sleeves seem pretty large, really wide. but not that big of a deal.i'd buy another in a different color.

column4: red kap men's slash pocket jacket, navy, small
column6: this quality of this coat is great for the money. i am a short stocky big guy (3xl) and certain coats do not fit. i sadly returned mine for the following reasons. 1. shoulders were to wide for my build. also the cuffs were to small around my wrists. fit well around my gut however. also my buddy has the same one and it fits his build perfectly. so bottom line try it, great value for the money, just be aware it may not fit everyone.

column4: red kap men's slash pocket jacket, navy, small
column6: nice quality jacket at a great price. i only wish it was available in more colors.

column4: red kap men's slash pocket jacket, navy, small
column6: i received my first jacket at my job. 7 years of being my go to jacket, it has been great spring and fall. winter time on top of a nice hoodie and thermal shirt, you're good to go.not overly thick but that's what i like most. it is still plenty warm and blocks wind and light rain. it is comfortable enough to become my cats favorite nap spot so i'll take her word on that.for 7 years of use, i still use it, have only had to replace 2 plastic buttons over the years, both on right sleeve which i use more, so that's understandable. plenty of other buttons on jacket you don't really need so use one of those for the important one if it breaks. i wash it in washing machine and dry in dryer, nothing fancy just throw it in with other clothes. it is actually remarkable how well it has held up, which inspired me to order my own without the work insignia or my name sewn on. and in a color i wanted. i checked the label on my work coat, saw red kap, and started my amazon search to find the right one (slash pocket jacket) i already knew a large fit me perfect (6' 0" 165lbs) and honestly the price was about 1/3 of what i expected, as it has outlasted way pricier jackets (carhartt).  only improvement would be a zipper pocket on the inside since slash pockets have a habit of spilling my phone but i can work around that. redd kap has gained a faithful fan, may not buy too much since they last so long, but will recommend to anyone anytime. heck, look at the photos, blue is 7 years old and grey is my new one. almost no difference after a lot of use.

column4: red kap men's slash pocket jacket, navy, small
column6: nice item. fits well

column4: red kap men's slash pocket jacket, navy, small
column6: the best thing about this jacket: not bulky but warm and the fit.worn this two weeks straight now.  i am 6' 6" and have always needed an extra large to get the sleeves to be long enough but in reality, i would take a large.  so i ordered a large tall and it fits perfectly.warmer than your lighter windbreaker jackets but not heavy like your snow jacket.  light but warm.  i was at a gas station getting gas on a windy night and was surprised at how i did not feel the chill on my upper body.there is one thing i don't care for but not a deal breaker for me. the cuffs have buttons but i don't use them as even the one that has the largest opening, i can't slide my hand through (i would have to unbutton every time to take off).  so i just leave it unbuttoned.

column4: red kap men's slash pocket jacket, navy, small
column6: so i bought this and returned the dickies version bec. this one has two buttons on the sleeve cuff.  unfortunately the bottom hem of the jacket - waistline is too tight.  its bec. the design of the jacket is sort of v shape.  it tapers in the lower half portion of the jacket.  otherwise it would’ve been perfect.

column4: red kap men's slash pocket jacket, navy, small
column6: i was looking for a jacket that was semi casual to wear just about everywhere in southern california and this jacket is perfect. the cut looks great, i am a little chunky right now so how it cuts in at the waist is perfect for hiding the gut. it is lose enough to easily move around in and be active if needed, i was a little afraid of it being too "work" looking, but it is not, looks great out to dinner or for hitting the beach on a walk. warm, but not too warm.

column4: red kap men's slash pocket jacket, navy, small
column6: i’m a taller man at 6’2 on the heavier side around 300 pounds. i’m very broad in the chest, back, and shoulders. i also carry a lot of my height in my torso. i went with a 3xl long and i cannot be any more satisfied. i’ve gotten several compliments and it is a great mid weight jacket that’s not too hot. it’s also not so bulky that it impedes on anything i may be doing which i love. can’t stand swimming in a bulky jacket!

column4: red kap men's slash pocket jacket, navy, small
column6: i bought this jacket as a replacement for the one i already had that happened to be appx 20 years old. the older one is far better quality, but this is an acceptable replacement. the color is nice too. i don't think it will hold up as well as my old jacket but it keeps me warm and is comfortable, which i suppose is all i can ask for in a jacket. even though i bought the same size the newer one runs far bigger than the older one, the sleeves are looser around the upper arm and the chest is way puffier. the outside material is the same, but the lining is different and seems easier to tear. overall i give this a 7/10

column4: red kap men's slash pocket jacket, navy, small
column6: xl jacket, i wear l, i cannot button up the cuffs lolololololol i can just see the factory workers being small ladies who don't see a problem with it.  otherwise it's holding up as a mechanics jacket being used as such.

column4: red kap men's slash pocket jacket, navy, small
column6: pros: the green color is very nice, darker than pictured- more like a forest/teal green. the canvas material is water resistant and sulfur day. the quilted inside is super warm, perfect fall jacket. jacket sits just below the waist which gives a nice cropped look.cons: the sleeves are massive. like almost comedically big. but that said it allows for a lot of flexibility when working/moving. there were also a lot of loose threads all around the jacket. not surprising given the price and it’s easy enough to go around it with scissors to clean it up.way cheaper than dickie’s eisenhower and maybe only 0.5 lower on the quality scale. not much to lose since it’s only $40sizing: 5’ 10”- bought a medium

column4: red kap men's slash pocket jacket, navy, small
column6: this jacket comes in many colors and sizes.  it is a great jacket for work

column4: red kap men's slash pocket jacket, navy, small
column6: i am very familiar with the dickies equivalent of this red kap jacket and this cannot in any way compare to dickies. sure it cost less but you get what you pay for. the material is thinner with sloppier stitching( they have even inserted wiry collar stiffeners to try to compensate!) mine came bagged but had been laundered with pulling and stains on the collar as well as a scent. yes it fits but this is truly one of my worst amazon experiences. i would rate it of the quality of iron curtain surplus. thank you, prime!

column4: red kap men's slash pocket jacket, navy, small
column6: pretty lightweight, not very warm but maybe that will be good when working. 6’ 195 lbs size lg fit perfect except sleeves are a little big. good jacket for the price

column4: red kap men's slash pocket jacket, navy, small
column6: stitching along the zipper could've been better. lots of loose string hanging from a couple spots (thought it was non-stitched gaps but nothing has come undone yet)

column4: red kap men's slash pocket jacket, navy, small
column6: good fit
